'''Dan Pruitt''' is a police officer who came to [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] after being shot during a bank robbery, and again after falling off a building during a chase.



While working as a cop, Dan and his partner, [[Brett Gibson|Brett]], arrested a kid named Jared. Jared, Dan said, was a good kid, but he got pulled into trouble which landed him in juvie. Dan and Brett still hoped Jared would have his moment, the moment where he either turned his life around or ended up in jail or dead.


Unfortunately, Jared chose to be an accomplice to some friends of his who were robbing a bank at gunpoint. When the police came into the bank, the suspects started shooting. They hit both Brett and his brother, [[Peter Gibson|Pete]], as well as Dan himself. The police brought their own wounded directly to the hospital, with Dan carrying Brett into the hospital and putting him on a gurney. He went between Brett and Pete, checking on how they were doing. When [[Callie Torres]] noticed that he was bleeding, she pulled him into a bay in the ER and tended to his leg. He'd been shot in the leg. His injury did not require surgery, just a splint, but he was told that he'd need to stay off it for at least six weeks, maybe eight. While he was in the hospital, he kept asking about how Brett, Pete, and Jared were doing. When he found out that Jared needed a liver and that Brett was a match for him, he talked to Brett and Pete's mom and asked her to donate Brett's liver to Jared, which she agreed to do. He hoped that once Jared healed, he'd be able to get him on the right path.

After Dan's leg was splinted, he was discharged from the hospital. As he was wheeled out of the hospital, Dan told Callie that if it were just a regular day, he'd ask her out on a date. She told him he'd need to come in for a follow-up visit in ten days. ''("[[When I Grow Up]]")''


After his follow-up, he went on a date with Callie. She said it started well, but then she discovered that he was boring, so she said there would be no second date. ''("[[Crazy Love]]")''


Dan was injured while chasing a suspect. He had fallen off a building that was under construction. He fractured his spine and both legs, the right worse than the left. Callie was able to identify him in the OR before his surgery.

After his surgery, Dan had a temporary abdominal closure, plus he needed more surgeries to fuse his spine. Callie told him she wasn't confident she'd be able to save his leg and either way, there was a long road ahead for him.


In a later surgery, Callie told Amelia she had talked to Dan about being a candidate for her bionic prosthetic, so it would delay his progress if his spinal fusion took longer than planned. His leg ultimately had to be amputated.

After his residual limb and other injuries had sufficiently healed, Callie got Dan up and walking on the robotic leg. She told him he had the best first run of any of her patients. ''("[[She's Leaving Home]]")''



After he was released from the hospital, Dan told [[Callie Torres]] that if it were a regular day, he'd asked her out for a date. She simply responded that he needed to come back in ten days for a follow-up visit. ''("[[When I Grow Up]]")''

They later went on a date, but Callie said Dan was boring, so there would be no second date. ''("[[Crazy Love]]")''

When he came back into the hospital after being injured again, Dan flirted with Callie, but she made it clear to him that she was just his doctor. ''("[[She's Leaving Home]]")''


Dan gets along well with his partner, [[Brett Gibson]] and another cop, [[Peter Gibson]], both of whom were injured in the bank robbery. He carried Brett into the ER himself and was reluctant to leave them in order to get his own wound treated.


During his time on the force, Dan met Jared, a  year old kid whom he said was susceptible to falling in with bad crowds. He and Brett arrested Jared and put him in juvenile detention in an attempt to try to straighten him out. When Jared was shot during the bank robbery, during which he had been waiting outside in the car, Dan thought it would be the moment, where he could turn his life around. When Jared needed a liver transplant and Brett was a match, Dan spoke to [[Mrs. Gibson]] and asked her to donate Brett's liver so Jared could get his chance.


Dan is a police officer in [[Seattle]]. He's been on the force for  years and he said that the bank robbery was the first time he'd ever had to fire his weapon, the first time they'd ever been shot at. [[Brett Gibson]] was his partner.

'''Dane Pinetti''' is a medical rep who tried to pitch a product to Cormac and Teddy.


Dane approached Teddy and Cormac at the Surgical Innovation Conference and introduced himself. He specifically pursued them because they work for a Catherine Fox hospital. He started to talk about his company's devices, but Cormac interrupted, talking about how one of their devices ended up killing his wife and how they knew that was a possible outcome, but still sold the device and paid money to hide the truth. After hearing this, Dane left.


He's a representative for Wilkes and Boon, a company that makes medical devices.

He is a lawyer.

'''Danielle Green''' is the mother of [[Peter Green]], who accidentally shot his friend.


Danielle came to the hospital, along with [[Patricia Cole]] when the police called both of them and told them one of their sons had been shot, but they didn't know which. When they found out that [[Brandon Cole|Brandon]], Patricia's son had been shot, Danielle was relieved. In the ER, they met up with [[Stacy]], the babysitter. She told them that the kids had found Patricia's gun and Peter shot Brandon with it. Danielle was shocked to learn that Patricia had a gun in the house.

While Brandon was in surgery, Danielle argued with Patricia over the gun, which Patricia said she kept locked up. Danielle was upset because she said that Patricia might have made her kid a murderer.

Brandon was left paralyzed after surgery and once he was in recovery and the police had finished their questioning, Danielle took Peter home.



She came to the hospital thinking her son, Peter, might have gotten shot. She was relieved when she found out he wasn't, but horrified to learn that he'd accidentally shot his friend.

'''Daya Burman''' is a patient who was having surgery so she could smile.


Daya was born with a condition which paralyzed her face, making her unable to make any normal facial expressions. After her mother died, her father backed out more than once on allowing her to have her surgery, which her mother had wanted her to have so she could finally smile like she wanted. On the most recent attempt, her father tried to back out again, but she talked to him and between her and the doctors, they convinced him of the importance of her having the surgery. The surgery went forward and afterward, Daya was told she'd need rehab and speech therapy and that the recovery would take a long time. When [[Katrina Scott]], her algebra teacher, came into the room, she was surprised to see her there. She then learned that her teacher and her father were seeing each other. Her father thought she'd be upset, but she said she was actually trying to smile.



Her mother had died. After her mother's death, her father became much more protective of her and didn't want her to have surgery because he was afraid he'd lose her.

'''Deborah Lee''' is the mother of [[Kayden Lee]].


Deborah came to the hospital when she learned that her son, Kayden, had been seriously burned. Due to Covid- restrictions, she and her husband had to wait outside the hospital while Kayden was treated, which was especially hard for Deborah. She decided to sneak in and look for Kayden. With Richard's help, she found him and spent some time looking over him before going back outside, where she told her husband how bad Kayden looked. When the parent of another child injured in the fire Kayden accidentally started, [[Aaron Morris]], arrived, Steve and Aaron got into a fight about the series of events that led to their kids getting injured. The fight became physical and both Steve and Aaron were injured. ''("[[All Tomorrow's Parties]]")''

Deborah then had to wait outside while her husband and son were treated. Kayden had to be taken back into surgery, where he died. Steve found out inside the ER before having to tell Deborah. ''("[[The Center Won't Hold]]")''



She is married to [[Steve Lee]].


She and her husband have a son, Kayden, who was severely burn after trying to fix his overheated car. ''("[[All Tomorrow's Parties]]")''


*During the lockdown, the Lees were still having cookouts with friends, unmasked.<ref>[[All Tomorrow's Parties]], x</ref>

'''Diamond''' is a teen who had a large ovarian cyst.


Diamond was attending the sexual education presentation at the hospital when she collapsed in pain. They took her for a CT scan, which showed a large ovarian cyst as well as ovarian torsion. She was taken into surgery, where the cyst was removed and blood flow was restored to her ovary. Despite some unexpected bleeding, the surgery was successful and her mother was told they were able to preserve both her ovaries.



Her mother came to the hospital to be with her when she had surgery.


*She likes anime.

'''Dominique Eldredge''' is the [[Attending|attending]] [[Emergency Medicine|emergency medicine physician]] at Tri-County Hospital on the prison floor.


Dr. Eldredge was reluctant to have the Grey Sloan doctors come into the prison hospital to help [[Kristen Rochester]], a pregnant inmate who needed a surgical procedure. When they arrived, she was short with them and clear about what she expected from them. When she took them into the room to examine Kristen, Kristen attacked her, dislocating her finger. She ordered Kristen be put in four-point restraints for  hours as punishment and when Kristen's lawyer, [[Amanda Joseph]], objected, she offered to place a call to the Sheriff about it. Bailey followed her into the hallway, where she was shocked to see Eldredge brush off her concern and reduce her own finger. She then left to buddy tape it to the next finger.

When Bailey treated another inmate, [[Lee]], and complained about the lack of available supplies, Eldredge took her into the supply closet and showed her that supplies were limited, leaving her to make difficult decisions about how to ration them among all the patients.

Eldredge was present in the room when Kristen eventually went into labor and started to deliver her baby. When the GSM doctors pleaded with her to remove two of the restraints, which were hurting Kristen's wrists as she pushed, she initially said it was too dangerous, but she eventually relented and had the restraints removed.

She later told the doctors that Kristen would be kept in the prison ward for a few days to recover and then she'd go back in the general prison population to serve the rest of her sentence. She and Bailey expressed their mutual respect and each offered a job to the other if she ever finds herself looking.


Eldredge is an [[Attending|attending]] [[Emergency Medicine|emergency medicine physician]] at Tri-County Hospital on the prison floor. Due to budget cuts, she had to make difficult decisions about how to distribute resources among patients.


*Although not explicitly stated, Eldredge is implied to be the [[Emergency Medicine|EM]] [[Attending#Department Head|head]] as she makes the decisions for emergency medicine resource allocation, she's able to override prison protocol regarding patient restraints, and she's able to hire staff (as she extended an invitation to [[Miranda Bailey]] if the latter wanted a new job).
*She had  patients, including  who were pregnant.

'''Donald Mercer''' was a patient at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].



When Donald needed a kidney transplant to save his life, his best friend, [[Thom]], offered to donate his.


Four months after the kidney transplant, Donald was in a car accident. He went through the windshield and fractured his skull, causing brain death. His wife consented to his organs being donated, but before they could harvest them, Donald became unstable and suffered cardiac death.



[[Marie Mercer]]
Donald was married to Marie Mercer until his death.


[[Thom]]
Thom was Donald\us best friend from seventh grade until his death. They were very close, to the point where Thom donated a kidney when Donald needed one. Thom was distraught when Donald died.

'''Duncan Mischer''' is a patient at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].


Miranda Bailey explained to him that they would be removing part of his colon to graft it into his throat after removing a tumor in his esophagus. His husband commented that now when he gives a restaurant a bad review, they can really say that he's talking out his ass, but Duncan counters that he can truly say their food tastes like crap. Bailey insisted that the food would not taste like crap.

Bailey and Jo Wilson operated. Duncan's bowel was perforated and there was leaking in his abdominal cavity which was ultimately resolved and the surgery was successful.



Duncan is married to [[Zach Mischer]].


Duncan is a restaurant critic. He once gave a negative review of a restaurant [[Miranda Bailey]] loved, Zane's, saying that they over-salt everything.

'''Dustin''' is the ex-boyfriend of [[Niki (Season )|Niki]].


Dustin was with his girlfriend, Niki, when she went into labor. This confused him as he hadn't realized she was pregnant, something she thought was obvious, but hadn't explicitly told him. He drove her to the hospital, where she was told she was going to give birth that day. Dustin, deciding he wasn't prepared to be a dad, left without telling Niki.



He and Niki dated for four weeks after matching on a dating app. When he learned she was pregnant when she went into labor, he left her.


*He charged [[Niki (Season )|Niki's]] phone and dropped it off with her [[Jo Wilson|doctor]] before he left.
*In addition to not being ready to be a father, he thought Niki's omission was a pretty big lie.
*He lives in a studio apartment.

'''Emily Rochester''' is the mother of [[Kristen Rochester]].


Emily came to the prison hospital when she learned that Kristen was having surgery to treat an acardiac twin that was threatening her pregnancy. She asked Arizona to come down to talk to her, which she did. She was shocked to learn that Emily was only there for the baby and didn't wish to see Kristen, despite the fact that Kristen had the right to have her mom there while she labored. After the baby was born, Arizona updated her on the baby, saying she'd stay in the NICU until she was ready to go home. Emily decided to name her Hannah despite Kristen wanting to name her Ellie and said she wouldn't be bringing the baby to see Kristen. Arizona angrily asked her if she'd abandon this one too when she messes up.



Her daughter, Kristen, is serving  to life in prison. She was pregnant while she was incarcerated and Emily adopted Kristen's baby as her own while refusing to see Kristen.


*Her casserole was first place at the block party three years running.

'''Frankie Morris''' is a kid who was injured while running away from a wildfire.


Frankie had a history of kidney disease. He eventually received a kidney transplant to treat it. At the start of the pandemic, his father told him this was their time to celebrate the doctors who had saved his life by doing their part and staying home. Despite this, Frankie decided to sneak out and go to a party with some of his friends, [[Kayden Lee]], [[Conor Jaxtimer]], and [[Billie]]. On the way there, Kayden's car overheated and Billie was burned when they took the cap off the radiator. Frankie called for help, but after the help left, Kayden tried to use gasoline to cool the car down and started a fire in the car which spread to the surrounding foliage. Frankie and Conor both immediately fled into the woods.

While running from the fire, Frankie was impaled on a tree branch, which injured his kidney. ''("[[Nothing Seems the Same]]")''

He was taken to the hospital where he had surgery. They had to remove a portion of his transplanted kidney, but the remaining kidney tissue was functioning and he was expected to make it. ''("[[The Center Won't Hold]]")''



He's being raised by his father. At the start of the lockdown, his father was strict about him staying home, saying it was his time to do something for the doctors who had helped save his life. When his father learned he had decided to sneak out for a party, he was angry at Frankie.


He is friends with [[Conor Jaxtimer]], [[Kayden Lee]], and [[Billie]]. They were graduating seniors during the pandemic and decided to break quarantine to have a party, which led to a fire and all four of them being injured and Kayden dying.


*He missed a year of school while he was sick and would have been valedictorian if he hadn't missed so much.<ref>[[Nothing Seems the Same]], x (S)</ref>

'''Gabby Margraff''' came into the ER after being in a bus crash.


Gabby and her boyfriend, [[Abraham|Abe]], were on a bus on the way to a cruise when the bus crashed. They were both taken to the ER and they were more concerned about each other than themselves. Gabby was taken to CT, which revealed a diaphragmatic hernia and possible splenic hematoma, leaving her in danger of her abdominal organs ended up in her chest if she coughed.

While she was getting a CT, she overheard [[Maggie Pierce|Maggie]] telling [[Meredith Grey|Meredith]] about her sexual exploits, leading her to share her own sexual history with them, encouraging Meredith not to give up on having sex after the death of her husband.

Gabby was taken into surgery, where her injuries were repaired. While she was in surgery, Abe died. When she learned the news, she was upset.



Gabby had been dating [[Abraham|Abe]] for five years. They met on a singles cruise and had been together ever since. He was planning to propose on their next cruise, but he died before he got the chance. Gabby was upset when she learned that Abe had died while she was in surgery.


*She's had an orgasm every day since she was .

'''Gideon''' is a cult member who dislocated his shoulder falling off a tree stump.


At some point, Gideon joined a cult led by [[Brother John]]. When John climbed on the roof and began to dance, Gideon danced along on the ground. When firefighters arrived to get John off the roof, Gideon told them they just didn't understand what John was doing. He also insisted the followers weren't doing drugs and were simply high on the magic of humanity.

Later, the firefighters noticed that Gideon was hyperventilating, but noted he could be doing it on purpose. However, he then sat back on a tree stump and fell off it, so they rushed to his aid. Despite being injured, including having disclosed his shoulder, he continued to dance and refused to let them treat him. When they tried, he licked Dean's forehead. Despite this, they continued to try to help him. [[Officer Buckner]] came over to help, but Gideon grabbed him around his chest with both arms. Buckner pushed him off, but let him continue dancing. Gideon then tried to lick his face too.

Gideon was still present when John jumped off the roof and he cheered with the rest of the cult when John emerged from the air bag.

'''Hannah Rochester''' is the baby born to [[Kristen Rochester]] and adopted by her mother, [[Emily Rochester]].


When Kristen was pregnant with Hannah, she was diagnosed with TRAP syndrome. The baby had an acardiac twin endangering her life by overworking her heart. [[Arizona Robbins]] did a surgical procedure to separate Hannah from the mass in order to save her life. During the procedure, Kristen became distressed and that caused her water to break and labor to start. Hannah was born a short time later. Kristen initially didn't want to hold her, but decided to when she heard her cry. Kristen told her to be good and then had Arizona take her. The plan was for her to be adopted by Kristen's mother.



She was adopted by her biological grandmother because her mother was in prison for  years to life.


*She was born at  weeks gestation.
*Kristen wanted to name her Ellie, but Emily decided to name her Hannah instead.

'''Henry''' is the boyfriend of [[Charlie Peterson]].


Henry's boyfriend, Charlie, was in the hospital on ECMO after three years awaiting a heart transplant. He was scheduled for a DOR procedure, but before he could have it, a heart became available. He initially refused the heart transplant, fearing that his new heart wouldn't love his boyfriend, Henry, like his old one, but was eventually persuaded to accept it when Henry broke up with him. During his transplant, they discovered that the heart was too large for his chest cavity due to edema. They transplanted the heart anyway and used plastic to wrap his chest cavity while they waited for the swelling to go down so they could close his chest. He was moved to the ICU for observation and Henry came back and regretted having said what he did because he only broke up with Charlie to get him to agree to the surgery.

They operated the next day and were able to close his chest. Charlie woke up and he and Henry reunited.



He and his boyfriend, Charlie, cosplay knights together.

'''Hollie Beaton''' is the mother of [[Arthur Beaton]].


Hollie's son, Arthur, was born with multiple ventricular septal defects. During the [[COVID- Pandemic|pandemic]], his parents took extra precautions because of his heart, but he still ended up in the hospital in heart failure. He'd been put on ECMO, but after  days, he still hadn't had a heart transplant. Desperate to do something to extend his time, Cormac suggested an artificial heart. Maggie rejected the suggestion, saying his chest cavity wasn't large enough to accommodate the cannulas and they'd have to leave his chest open to avoid compressing his other internal organs. Cormac then suggested removing both his ventricles, giving them the extra space they needed. Chris consented to the surgery, so they proceeded. After surgery, Arthur was stable and waiting for his new heart.



She is married to [[Chris Beaton]].


She experienced deep depression during the pandemic while her son was hospitalized due to his heart.

'''Irene Davis''' is Cormac's sister-in-law.



At the start of the pandemic, Irene insisted on moving to Seattle to help her brother-in-law care for her nephews.

Irene was at home watching cat videos when she had a sudden abdominal pain. A few days later, she went to the ER because the pain hadn't resolved. Jo suspected she had a kidney stone and ordered a CT to confirm. The CT showed a large kidney stone in her right ureter, so Jo called Catherine to consult on the case. Catherine said she'd need lithotripsy to break up the stone and remove it. The procedure went well, but when Catherine removed the scope, Irene's ureter came with it. Catherine converted to an exploratory laparotomy to try to re-attach the ureter to her kidney, but found it was too short, so she had to remove the kidney and re-attach it elsewhere. After the surgery, Irene was told she was stable and was producing urine. She was told she could go home in three days if her pain was under control. ''("[[Breathe]]")''


Irene had Liam and Austin stay with her in San Diego over Thanksgiving. ''("[[Everyday Is a Holiday (With You)]]")''



Her sister, [[Abigail Hayes|Abigail]], died after a medical device caused cancer to spread throughout her body. After this, she stepped up and became a large part in her nephews' lives. Her sister's death made her distrustful of western medicine, causing her to seek alternative treatments for her ailments.


*She was  at the time of her hospitalization.

'''JJ''' was a patient who was admitted to the hospital after being severely burned.



JJ was at a tailgate party for a Seahawks game and she was severely burned. She was taken to [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]], where her burns were treated.


A few weeks after she was admitted, another burn patient, [[Anne Chambers]] was admitted after being in a house fire. When Anne was being prepped for her first debridment, JJ shouted out words of advice.

Later, Anne's nerves started to grow back, so the pain of her treatments intensified, so to get her through, JJ made jokes about how Jo was Snow White and they were dwarves, Burny and Screamy. They also dubbed [[Dan Pruitt|Dan]] Stumpy and the woman who was in the ER with Anne Bitchy. When Anne's husband, [[Lance Chambers|Lance]], got upset with them for joking and left the room, JJ dubbed him Scaredy.

At Christmas, Lance brought Anne a present and left her. JJ heard it happened and frantically called for a doctor because Anne was upset. Jo gave Anne something to calm her down and JJ said it was good because he wasn't good enough for her and now this is her fresh start and she proclaimed the day their first Christmas. They began to sing Christmas carols together.

On New Years Eve, JJ and Anne stayed up to watch the ball drop and then even later just to talk, so Anne told her she'd take the first pain session in the morning. However, when Jo went in to check on JJ, she found that she had died. Anne was devastated to hear that JJ had died.



When [[Anne Chambers]] was put in the bed next to hers in the burn unit, they developed a strong friendship, starting with JJ giving Anne advice on dealing with the pain. When JJ died on New Years Day, Anne was devastated.


She was a volunteer firefighter.

'''Jada Williams''' is a young girl who was kidnapped by a human trafficking ring.


Jada and her friend, [[Shanice]], were having a sleepover. They'd been talking to someone on Instagram whom they believed to be a young influencer who offered to teach them how to make a lot of money. They left the house in the middle of the night to meet her, but when they arrived, she wasn't there. Instead, [[Robert Corson|Bob Corson]] grabbed them and put them in a van. He then took them back to his house and locked them in a room in the basement.

Jada and Shanice heard voices, which made them believe they were being rescued. They then didn't hear voices anymore, so they decided to start a fire to try to lure rescue. They started the fire and watched as it burned around them. They were finally rescued when the fire drew the attention of the firefighters outside. Sullivan and Dean decided not to wait for gear and went into the house in their street clothes. They followed the girls' voices to the basement and then to a locked door. They kicked in the door and pulled both girls out. Once they were outside, they started breathing again. When Shanice was loaded into an aid car, she explained what had happened and apologized. There was a confrontation between the cops and the others, during which Jada's mother, Joyce, was arrested, along with two firefighters. Jada and Shanice were taken to the hospital to be treated. ''("[[Out of Control]]")''

In the ER, Jada was treated for smoke inhalation and burns on her hands. When she told the doctors about her mother being arrested, Jackson called his lawyers and they were able to get her out so she could come to the hospital and be with her daughter. Then she was told if her next x-ray was clear, she could take Jada home. ''("[[No Time for Despair]]")''



When she went missing, her mother immediately went into action to find her. At the hospital, she told Sharon that her father was in Nevada seeing her grandmother, who wouldn't stop going in public without a mask.


*She was  years old at the time of her abduction.

'''Jake Elmore''' is the husband of [[Kathy Elmore]].


Jake's wife, Kathy, came into the hospital in labor, fully dilated. By the time they got her into a bed, she was already crowning. With all the OBs in the hospital busy, nurse [[Terri Akumbu]] pulled Jo Wilson in from the hospital, as hospital rules required a doctor to be present at the delivery. Terri coached Jo through the delivery and then Jo handed the newborn over to his parents. Jake cut the cord and Kathy and Jake happily held their newborn.



He is married to [[Kathy Elmore]].


He and his wife have three children, including one born during the [[COVID- Pandemic]].

'''Jamie Hall''' is the homecoming dance date of [[Pete Hover]].


Jamie came to the hospital when her friend, Pete, planned an elaborate invitation to homecoming, involving a hot air balloon and him wearing a tuxedo. However, the landing of the hot air balloon went badly and he ended up in the hospital with abdominal trauma and a broken leg as well as flash burns to his arms. His burns were debrided in the ER and then he was taken into surgery. After surgery, Jamie was told he would have to use a wheelchair or maybe crutches, but he could still go to homecoming. Jamie was surprised that news had spread and made her popular, giving her several other options for homecoming dates and so wasn't sure she'd accept. April talked to her and told her she should go for the boy who had put so much into making it special for her. After some thought, Jamie decided to accept his invitation.



She agreed to go to homecoming dance with [[Pete Hover]].


*She runs track.

'''Janice''' is an actor whose production was interrupted with an accident.


Janice was performing in a park as part of a touring fairytale theater production of Rapunzel when the actor playing the prince, [[Jeremy (Today Was a Fairytale)|Jeremy]], fell while climbing the prop hair and injured himself. Janice stayed nearby to help as Jo and Link stepped in to treat him. She called for an ambulance, but it was delayed in arriving. When [[Luna Ashton]] started crying, Janice offered to help with her and ended up moving her closer to Jo and then singing to her a little to calm her down.


She is an actor with a traveling fairytale theater production of Rapunzel in which she plays Rapunzel.

{{Intern and Resident Infobox |image = JasonMyersIB.png |name = Jason Myers |alias = *Chest Peckwell *Super Douche *Assface |status = Alive |title = M.D. |job = [[Obstetrics and Gynecology|OB/GYN]] [[Resident]] |workplace = '''Current'''
[[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]
'''Former'''
[[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]] |first appearance = [[Hard Bargain]] |last appearance = [[Readiness is All]] |count = |seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] |portrayed by = [[Charles Michael Davis]] }} '''Jason Myers''' is an [[Obstetrics and Gynecology|obstetrics and gynecology]] [[Resident|resident]] at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] who briefly dated [[Jo Wilson]]. Jason was first seen when Alex asked Jo to go to [[Emerald City Bar|Joe's]] with him to have a drink. She apologized and said she already had plans for that night, and she walked up to Jason, who was waiting for her down the hall. A disappointed Alex asked Stephanie who the guy was, and she told him that they nicknamed him Chest Peckwell and that Jo finally dared to ask him out, something she had wanted to do ever since she first saw him.\ua''("[[Hard Bargain]]")'' They grew closer and discussed whether or not\ua[[Obstetrics and Gynecology|obstetricians-gynecologist]]\uacould be considered surgeons. Jo mocked him for his pink scrubs, and he gave up. "You really pull it off though," she complimented him, after which she wanted to kiss him, but Alex interrupted by entering the elevator. Jo introduced him to Jason, but Alex only cared about his patient. Alex took the stairs instead of going up with them in the elevator. At the end of the day, Alex interrupted Jo and Jason again at Joe's to apologize to Jo for the way he had been treating her. He asked her if he could buy her a drink, but Jason made it clear that he wanted him to leave.\ua''("[[Transplant Wasteland]]")'' One of Alex's patients was really attached to Jo, and when Jason entered the room to talk to his girlfriend, the kid popped out his IV, causing the fluid to spill on Jason's pants. "Don't sweat it, little man," Jason friendly says, but the kid replied that he's already, but that his growth got stunted by a lifetime of cancer. Jason awkwardly left with Jo. Behind his back, Alex and the kid made a deal to fool Jason. They paged him to the ER, and he kept on looking for a patient, not knowing that there was no patient. [[File:JasonPrankPhotos.png|thumb|px|One of the photos Alex took of Jason looking for his patient.]] He went to the ER, to ortho, then back to the ER and even to the cafeteria, and unbeknownst to him, Alex took pictures of him to show to the kid. They later paged him for another patient, now with a name: Talia. The nurse told him that he could treat her if he could find her. "I'm looking for a miss Talia, Jenny Talia! I'm here to see Jenny Talia" he yelled, only to be laughed at by everyone in the ER. Jason later gave Bailey his urine sample, as he read on the memo that she was in charge of the random drug test policy. Jason heard Alex and Richard, who joined Alex and the kid, laughing at him. Jason took back the cup and left. In the evening, he approached Alex, saying he really got him with the pranks. Alex says the kid got a little crush on Jo. "Oh, the kid does. Right, well you two kids have fun laughing about it later while I'm nailing Jo in the bathroom at the bar," Jason told him, and he then went to talk to Jo in the kid's room.\ua''("[[Idle Hands]]")'' Jo and Jason started to make out in the conference rooms at the hospital every chance they got. Alex interrupted them a first time to tell Jo that she had to check her pager. April had a pregnant patient, whose baby had to be delivered right away. As OB hadn't made it to the ER yet, Alex jumped in and took the patient to the OR. He told a nurse to ask OB to meet them in the OR. Jason was in time to deliver the baby, where Alex mentioned he was slow. Jason told him he was being unprofessional. He later met Alex and Stephanie, who was busy listing some of Jason's qualities to Alex, in the NICU. Jason brought the father of the baby with him, and he allowed the father to hold his newborn daughter. The mother of the baby later died in the ICU, and as April couldn't bring herself to go tell the patient's husband, Alex asked Jason to do it, as the family knew and trusted him. However, Jason refused to do it as Elyse wasn't his patient anymore. They started arguing again, and Jason brought up Jo again. When Jason refused to come with him to tell the father, Alex mentioned he'd be doing his job again.\ua''("[[Can't Fight This Feeling]]")'' Jason asked her to move in with him, which she accepted. Cristina and Alex had to perform a cardiothoracic surgery on a baby that Jason had to deliver. She proposed to deliver the baby in the cath lab to save time. Both Alex and Jason were against the idea, but when Cristina asked him if he wanted to be the badass that delivered the kid in a cath lab, Jason decided to side with her. They both called him Peckwell, so he tried to get them to call him Jason Myers, but Cristina told him nobody cared about his name. Jason successfully performed the C-section. When Alex informed Jason on the baby's condition, Jason told Alex that he really appreciated his work today and that the thing with Jo got them off on a bad foot. "She cares a lot about you," Jason said, and Alex assured him that they were just friends. Alex then opened up to him and said that he and Jo had a similar past as foster kids, but she had it way worse than him. He says that she was unhoused and lived in her car, and that he now wants the best for her as she managed to turn her life around. Jason was surprised, as Jo hadn't told him about her crappy past. Jason and Jo got into a fight because she hadn't told him.\ua''("[[Sleeping Monster]]")'' As Alex and Jackson left to have a drink at Joe's, they saw Jo and Jason were having a serious fight. Alex kept on walking, as Jo specifically told him to stay out of her life. Back at his apartment, their fight continued until Jason grabbed Jo's arm, which prompted Jo to hit him a few times until he fell back and hit his head and was unconscious. While Jo went to Alex's house, Alex went to Jason's house and took him to the hospital.\ua''("[[Do You Believe in Magic]]")'' Alex brought Jason into the hospital severely beaten. He had a temporal bone fracture and an epidural hemorrhage. He was taken into an OR to evacuate the bleed. In surgery, they discovered that his dura was torn. After surgery, he woke up and appeared to be fine. However, he was asking for the cops. Alex went in and talked to him and pressured him not to press charges against Jo. ''("[[Readiness is All]]")'' He was a [[Obstetrics and Gynecology|OB/GYN]] [[Resident|resident]] that has operated on cases requiring [[Cardiothoracic Surgery|cardio]] and [[Pediatric Surgery|peds]] consults, allowing him to work with [[Cristina Yang|Cristina]] and [[Alex Karev|Alex]], respectively. xChestPeckwell.png|[[Hard Bargain]] xJasonMyers.png|[[Transplant Wasteland]] xJasonMyers.png|[[Idle Hands]] xJasonMyers.png|[[Can't Fight This Feeling]] xJasonMyers.png|[[Sleeping Monster]] xJasonMyers.png|[[Do You Believe in Magic]] xJasonMyers.png|[[Readiness is All]] Promo.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg Promo.jpg Promo.jpg Promo.jpg {{Jason Myers Appearances}} [[de:Jason Myers]] [[fr:Jason Myers]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Myers, Jason}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:GA Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:Doctors]] [[Category:Patients]] [[Category:Patients (ER)]] [[Category:Patients (Neuro)]] [[Category:Patients (Trauma)]]

'''Jaylen Donovan''' was a patient at [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]] who received a kidney transplant after three years of dialysis to treat kidney failure.


After three years of dialysis to treat her kidney failure, a kidney became available for Jaylen. When Alex went with Jaylen's parents to tell her about the kidney, they found her kissing her boyfriend, [[Thelonious|Theo]].

While Alex was reviewing the post-transplant meds she'd need to take afterward, she became upset upon hearing some of the potential side effects and locked herself in a bathroom. Alex went down to the dialysis area and took Theo's phone in order to text Jaylen. She came out to say she knew it was Alex texting, but she agreed to speak with him only if he'd come into the bathroom with her. She tried to get him to put off the transplant as she wasn't ready, but he talked her into accepting the transplant, saying she needs to take the good things when they're in front of her. She agreed and the transplant went on as scheduled.



Jaylen was seeing [[Thelonious]], whom she met at dialysis. They had been getting dialysis together for about a year when a kidney became available for Jaylen.


Jaylen's parents did not like that she was seeing another dialysis patient. When she locked herself in the bathroom to avoid her kidney transplant, they were upset about it.


*She was  at the time of her kidney transplant.
*Her parents once took her phone away and she didn't speak to them for  days.

'''Jeffrey King''' was a patient who had stage A colon cancer that had spread to his liver.


Jeffrey had a history of colon cancer that had spread to his liver. He was ineligible for liver transplant, so Meredith planned a procedure that involved rerouting blood flow through one side of the liver, allowing it to grow more healthy tissue while depriving the cancerous side. A second surgery would remove the cancerous part. His initial surgery went well, but later that day, he threw a clot and despite Meredith's best efforts, he died.



He was married until his wife died of a aneurysm suddenly, eight years prior to his own death.


He has a very good working relationship with [[Robert Souza]], whom he mentored. Despite job offers, Robert decided to stay and continue working for Jeffrey.


He is a judge who works with immigrants, refugees, domestic violence survivors, and foster children, among others.

After his surgery, he gave Jo some advice on her own situation.


*He was  at the time of his death.

She is a nurse in the ICU at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].

'''Jeremy''' is the best friend of [[Veronica Kays]].



Jeremy came to the clinic when his best friend, [[Veronica Kays|Veronica]], was there waiting for tests after Alex noticed a rash on her hands at the courthouse. They soon learned that Veronica, who was pregnant with Jeremy's child, had advanced pancreatic cancer. The doctors recommended that Veronica terminate the pregnancy so she could start treatment immediately. The treatment would only give her about another year, but without it, she wouldn't live long enough to deliver a healthy baby.

Bailey, with pressure from Veronica, who wanted their baby to be able to grow up with Jeremy, whom she said would be a great dad, agreed to do a Whipple to remove the bulk of the tumor, with the hopes it would give her enough time to deliver a healthy baby before dying.

While Veronica was in surgery, Jeremy confessed to Alex that he didn't know what to do. Alex advised him to show up, that that was all he could do and the best thing he could do. ''("[[Roar]]")''


When she was  weeks and  days pregnant, Veronica came back to the hospital with back pain, which she'd had for a week. An MRI showed that the cancer had spread to her spine and she needed to have a c-section that day. Before her surgery, she signed a DNR. Arizona easily delivered her baby, but she developed a clot that went to her lung and she struggled to breathe after the delivery. They said she could rescind her DNR, but she said she was tired and so they just stayed with her while she died. After she was gone, Alex told Jeremy about her death and he cried. ''("[[Don't Stop Me Now]]")''



He and [[Veronica Kays|Veronica]] have a son together.


He and Veronica met as children and became friends. Their friendship remained into adulthood, when they made a pact to have a baby together at age  if they were still single then. When the time came, the learned it would be expensive. However, a drunken night led to them conceiving a child together. Veronica thinks he'd be an amazing father. ''("[[Roar]]")''

As she was dying, she admitted that she loved Jeremy and had never told him that. She asked Amelia to tell him not to look back and to be brave for their son. ''("[[Don't Stop Me Now]]")''

'''Jeremy''' is an actor who was injured when he fell during a show due to a cardiac episode.


Jeremy was performing in a touring fairytale theater production of Rapunzel when he had sudden chest pain and fell from a distance onto the stage, breaking his leg. When Link reduced the open fracture, Jeremy went into cardiac arrest, so JO started CPR. While they were working on him, his friend, [[Cathi]], said that he had a heart condition and showed them his medical alert bracelet, which said he had CCTGA. She also said there was an AED in the park, so they sent her to retrieve it. While she was gone, Jeremy started bleeding profusely as the artery in his leg had been lacerated. Link held pressure and then used Cathi's belt as a tourniquet, which he secured with Jeremy's prop sword. They attached the AED and used it to deliver a few shocks to his heart. When that didn't help, they called out to the crowd to ask for EpiPens and injected them. They were able to restore sinus rhythm. When the ambulance arrived, Link rode with him to the hospital, where he had surgery to repair his leg. He coded during his surgery, but they were able to resuscitated. Cathi was told he'd need a permanent pacemaker, but would be okay.



HIs family lives in Philadelphia and he hasn't seen them in years.


He and [[Cathi]] are very close. She describes them as family.


He is an actor with a traveling fairytale theater. He's been doing this for six years with [[Cathi]].

You've taken your darkest experiences that life gave you, and you turned it around and turned it into light. And if the woman who gave birth to you doesn't want to see that, then that's on her.|'''[[Meredith Grey]]''' to Jo}} '''Jo Wilson''', formerly '''Brooke Stadler''' and '''Jo Karev''', is an [[Obstetrics and Gynecology|obstetrics and gynecology]] [[resident]] at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. She was previously an [[attending]] [[General Surgery|general surgeon]] before switching specialties. Following her [[Paul Stadler|estranged husband]]'s death, she married [[Alex Karev]] until he left her for his ex-wife, [[Izzie_Stevens|Izzie]]. She is now the mother of [[Luna Ashton]]. At only five days old, Jo Wilson was left by her [[Vicki Ann Rudin|mother]] at a fire station. She was shuffled among numerous foster homes until age when she began living independently out of her car. Her teacher, Ms. Schmidt, would let her into the school building early to use the school showers and to do laundry. Jo worked furiously to get through school, graduating as high school valedictorian and moving on to Princeton University, where she graduated cum laude. Wilson then attended [[Harvard Medical School]], where she graduated at the top of her class. Wilson confessed to [[Alex Karev]] that Ms. Schmidt was the only person who supported her and thus the only one at her graduation. During a conversation with [[Andrew DeLuca]], Jo revealed that she is married. She said, "when I bought something wrong, he'd hit me in my face, or my stomach..." Being done with his abusive behavior, Jo fled to somewhere he'd never find her: Seattle. She claimed that if she tried to divorce him, he would find her. Jo kept her past confidential until after Alex proposed when she drunkenly confesses to Andrew that, that was the reason. She also admitted that 'Jo Wilson' isn't her real name. Her real name was 'Brooke Stadler'.[[Family Affair]], x Jo started her internship at [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]] shortly after the [[Flight|plane crash]]. She quickly learned, along with the other interns, to fear [[Meredith Grey]], dubbing her Medusa. Meredith was put in charge of choosing an intern for the intern appy and she chose Jo. As the other interns gathered in the gallery and unknowingly insulted Meredith with the intercom on, Jo started the surgery under Meredith's supervision. Jo successfully took out the appendix but ripped the cecum afterward. As Meredith pressed her to think and act, Jo froze as expected. Meredith had to finish the surgery. After the surgery, Owen found Jo crying in the hallway. He told her to cry elsewhere and informed her that the intern appy is designed for the intern to fail to set an example for the others. Jo then asked him why Meredith was so mean, bringing up the plane crash she had heard about. Owen told her that Meredith wasn't mean but strong and that she was so hard on Jo in order to teach her the way she deserved to be taught.[[Going, Going, Gone]], x When she wanted to scrub in on a surgery, she flirted with Callie to try to make it happen. However, Callie pointed out that Jo looked terrified that Callie might take her up on that offer, meaning she probably isn't into ladies. Callie told her not to trade sex for scrubbing in because that's skanky, to save it for actually getting to cut. Then she sent her to go suck up to Alex instead. He said no and when he saw her watching from the gallery, he sent her away. Later, when he scolded her for charting when she hadn't scheduled a consult for him, she began to cry, freaking him out. At this point, Jo and Alex were late to their own wedding and they had to move locations because the wedding planner had an allergic reaction and there was blood all over everything. They all got on a ferry boat, and [[Maggie Pierce|Maggie]] suggested Jo and Alex get married on the ferry, with Meredith officiating.[[All of Me]], x After Jo visited her birth mother and found out the truth about her father, she fell into a depressive state. Alex stayed by her side, helping her at therapy. She hated the fact that she was another one of his crazy women, and said that they weren't even married, which gave him an out. However, Alex told her later that he didn't want an out. He wanted to marry her again. They got remarried on Halloween.[[Whistlin' Past the Graveyard]], x When Alex disappeared to Iowa to visit his mother, Jo began to worry, as he wasn't responding to any of her texts or calls. He was supposedly dealing with something, but Jo worried that he was getting revenge for when she needed time, even though she knew he would never do that. While operating on a patient whose wife cheated on him, she started to think that maybe Alex was cheating on her. [[Owen Hunt|Owen]] told her that it had taken him and Teddy, like Jo and Alex, a long time to get where they were, and he wasn't going to screw that up for anything. He reassured her that Alex wouldn't, either. She feared that he left her for good after calling his mom and finding out that Alex had never gone to Iowa. Shortly after that, she got a letter from him saying that he had reconnected with his ex-wife, Izzie (now a successful surgical oncologist) and had been living in Kansas with her and their two children, Alexis and Eli. He revealed that he had never fallen out of love with Izzie, and realized that her having their kids was everything he needed to go back to her. He told Jo that he would not be returning to Seattle and left her divorce papers.[[Leave a Light On]], x [[Levi Schmitt]] Jo had a one-night stand with Levi after he came to the bar to apologize to her.[[Break Down the House]], x He later returned her badge to her, which embarrassed her. When he came to her later about a potential donor he had found, she took the case from him, upsetting him.[[Get Off on the Pain]], x After finding out from [[Olivia Jankovic]] that [[Alex Karev|Alex]] had had syphilis in the past, he was worried he should get himself checked. Jo assured him she didn't have syphilis.[[Bad Reputation]], x After Levi came out as gay and after he broke up with Nico and Jo was left by Alex she invited Levi to move in with her.[[Love of My Life]], x The two established a close friendship.[[Sing It Again]], x [[Atticus Lincoln]] Link and Jo have known each other since they were undergrads. They waited tables at Jimmy's Crab Shack together. They describe themselves as being like brother and sister. When a girlfriend of his broke up with him, he was distraught and Jo came by his place to spend time with him even though he wanted to be alone. She insisted on staying and did his laundry for him. Her company helped him through that rough patch and he returned the favor when she returned from meeting her mother. [[Stephanie Edwards]] Jo and Stephanie had a strong friendship that developed throughout their residency, and were there for each other through their hardest times. Jo helped Stephanie get through [[April and Jackson's Wedding|Jackson leaving her for April]], and Stephanie helped Jo when Alex and Jo broke up. Jo was devastated when Stephanie quit her job after the hospital fire. She attempted to fill the hole Stephanie left with [[Ben Warren]]. [[Meredith Grey]] When Meredith was publishing her abdominal wall transplant, she wanted to put Jo's name on the paper, but she also needed a picture, and Jo couldn't give a picture because then [[Paul Stadler|Paul]] would find her, so she asked Meredith to take her name off of the article. From that point on, Meredith was very protective of Jo and was even nice to her when [[Alex Karev|Alex]] asked. Then when Paul surprised Jo at the hospital, Meredith was there to comfort her and to keep her safe from Paul. She comforted her by saying "You're Jo Wilson. I know exactly who you are." Meredith kept Alex from Paul, so Alex didn't kill him, and Meredith sat with Jo while she was signing the divorce papers. She also protected her when Paul came back and was threatening Jo for talking to Jenny, Meredith "called security" even though the phones weren't working. After that, when Meredith was dealing with the mini spleens in [[Judy Kemp]], Jo wished that a mini-spleen situation would happen for a useful organ, which gave Meredith the idea for her contest entry: mini livers. Since Jo helped find an important piece, she put Jo as her partner for the contest, and they created their mini livers together. After Jo's return to the hospital, Meredith has taken on a sisterly role to Jo, helping her out whenever she needs help. Dr. Wilson graduated cum laude from Princeton University and [[Harvard Medical School]]. She obtained a spot at the most wanted [[Resident|residency-match]], [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital|Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital's]] [[General Surgery|surgical program]]. Dr. Wilson was named by [[Meredith Grey]] as the most promising [[Internship|intern]] and was thus awarded the first surgery of the rotation, which is in fact given to interns they think will fail. As expected, she did fail to complete the surgery and while crying about it, [[Owen Hunt|Dr. Owen Hunt]] informed her that it was an exercise meant to be a learning experience. The surgery is "designed" for the chosen intern to fail to set an example for the other interns. When [[Richard Webber]] asked Meredith to choose one of the [[Resident|residents]] to assist with the surgery on him, Jo Wilson was selected. After assisting [[Callie Torres|Dr. Torres]] in a surgery, Jo was caught in the backlash as Callie was [[Sorry Seems to Be the Hardest Word|sued for malpractice]]. When a patient in the E.R. broke his arm due to a tetanic contraction, Jo scrubbed in with Callie on his fracture repair. She discovered a love of [[Orthopedic Surgery|ortho]] and has since been scrubbing in with Callie often. During Jo's fifth-year of residency, she has been chosen as [[Resident#Chief Resident|Chief Resident]]. Since Callie's departure, she has been showing an interest in [[General Surgery|general surgery]] and has been scrubbing in with Meredith often. Her interest in general surgery has also led her to closely work with Meredith in the [[Grey Sloan Surgical Innovation Contest]]. Towards the end of her fifth-year, [[Massachusetts General Hospital|MassGen]] offered Jo a minimally-invasive surgery fellowship. Meredith was also ready to offer her a general surgery [[Attending|attending]] position at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital|Grey Sloan]].[[All of Me]], x Ultimately, she declined MassGen's offer and decided to stay in Seattle to become a Surgical Innovation Fellow. After her time at the psychiatric hospital, Jo returned to Grey Sloan and became an attending general surgeon.[[Back in the Saddle]], x She showed excellent skills in the absence of Meredith and became one of the highest-regarded general surgeons of the hospital. During the COVID- pandemic, Jo discovered the joy of [[Obstetrics and Gynecology|OB/GYN]] and began taking steps to change specialties. Because she received special dispensation from Chief [[Miranda Bailey|Bailey's]] recommendation due to already having completed a [[General Surgery|surgical residency]], she did not have to repeat the first intern year and is a second-year of her OB/GYN residency at the time of her transition.[[Good as Hell]], x *Jo once dressed up as Tinkerbell for Halloween.[[Thriller]], x *Jo frequently used [[Heather Brooks|Heather's]] deodorant without telling her. *Jo believed her mother left her at a fire station at two weeks old, but her birth mother would later claim she dropped her off when she was five days old. *There is a timeline discrepancy regarding how long Jo's residency is, as she begins her fellowship in , six years after she began her internship. *She is allergic to wool.[[Man on the Moon]], x *As a teenager, Jo lived in her car. *Jo is very good at math.[[The Face of Change]], \ud *Her screensaver is a picture of the Catherine Fox Award. *She hates cats and beaches.[[I'm Winning]], x *Jo sends out her laundry. *She has some anger problems. *Jo has been in jail before, and fears that if she loses her job as a doctor she will end up there again. *She won $ from Alex after betting on Shane to win when he was playing ping pong with [[Derek Shepherd]] for his rehab. She used the money to buy him a couch.[[The End is the Beginning is the End]], x *When Jo gets nervous, she gets hives and can't eat or she will throw up. *Jo kept a gun under the bed where she and Alex slept.[[Trigger Happy]], x *She stole cars when she was younger.[[Where Do We Go From Here]], x *Although a majority of her surgical residency was spent rotating in [[Pediatric Surgery|pediatric surgery]], Jo showed a keen interest in [[Orthopedic Surgery|orthopedic surgery]].[[I'm Winning]], x This interest faded when Callie left and Jo has since switched to [[Obstetrics and Gynecology|OB/GYN]]. *She can cry on cue.[[Things We Said Today]], x *She's good at writing dirty text messages.[[It's Alright, Ma (I'm Only Bleeding)]], x *Jo once helped her old boyfriend rob a grocery store. *She once lived in Connecticut.[[Old Scars, Future Hearts]], x *She is the second or third character to change her name after getting married, following [[Addison Forbes Montgomery]] and possibly [[Callie Torres]]. '''John Brinn''' is the father of [[Bobby Brinn]], a patient at [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]].


John's son, Bobby, had a tumor in his abdomen. When Bobby heard them talking about it, he thought it was a little man, whom he named Phil. His parents threw him an "Adios, Phil!" party prior to his surgery to remove the tumor.

The surgery was successful and Bobby was left tumor-free.



He is married to [[Lisa Brinn]] and they have a son, [[Bobby Brinn]].


His son, Bobby, was hospitalized to have a tumor removed from his abdomen.

'''Joyce Williams''' is the mother of [[Jada Williams]].


Joyce's daughter, Jada, and her friend, [[Shanice]], were having a sleepover. When Joyce woke up in the morning, she discovered that Jada and Shanice were both missing. She traded Jada's phone down by the water, but then the signal went dead, making her think whoever had taken her had thrown her phone in the water. She then tracked Jada's fitness watch, which led to a house at th Avenue and Newland. She knocked on the door, but [[Robert Corson|Bob Corson]] slammed the door in her face. So she yelled for help and drew the attention of Dean, Travis, and Vic, who were at [[Maya and Carina's Apartment|Maya's place]] for a post-fire celebration. She explained to them what had happened and asked for help getting her daughter out of the house. She had called the police, but they never came to her house like they said they would. She went to the station, where she filed a report, but they told her it could take days to get a warrant, so she came to the house herself. Three Black girls had disappeared from her neighborhood in the last year and the police had done nothing. She'd been unable to reach [[Sharon (Season )|Sharon]], Shanice's mom, so Vic suggested calling her again and then contacting all the girls' friends to check social media. Joyce started making calls to all their friends, but no one had seen them. Frustrated, Dean decided to go to the door and knock. Bob again denied having the girls in his house. Dean wanted to pretend he smelled a gas leak to get access to the house, but Maya stopped him and called the police herself.

Police arrived soon afterward, but they said they were there not in response to Joyce and Maya's calls, but because Bob had reported trespassers. They refused to help Joyce find her daughter, so Dean again said he smelled gas and the other firefighters agreed they smelled it as well. They knocked on the door, but Bob denied them access to check it out. But a few minutes later, they heard glass breaking and saw that a fire had burst out a basement window. Bob came out of the house coughing. Sullivan and Dean then went into the house in search of the girls. They found them and brought them out, but Bob claimed the girls were lying and had broken into his house. When Shanice admitted that they'd started the fire to lure rescue, the cops accused Shanice and Jada of lying. When Joyce heard this, she lunged at [[Officer Schneider]], but Maya held her back. Despite this, Schneider arrested her. In the ensuing chaos, Dean and Sullivan were also arrested unjustly. The three were then loaded into cop cars and driven away while Jada and Shanice were taken to the hospital. ''("[[Out of Control]]")''

Her daughter's doctor, [[Jackson Avery]], posted bail for Joyce upon hearing the full story. He had her brought to Jada's room at Grey Sloan, where they were reunited. ''("[[No Time for Despair]]")''

Dean sued the police department in response to what happened to him and to Joyce. When they offered a settlement, Joyce said she wanted to take it and Dean decided to agree to the settlement, knowing it would help Joyce more than continuing the lawsuit. ''("[[Forever and Ever, Amen]]")''



She is married. Her husband was said to be in Nevada to see his mother, who had been refusing to wear her mask in public.


When her daughter disappeared in the middle of the night, she tracked her and helped aid in her safe recovery.

'''Julie Hamilton''' is a fifth grader who came to the hospital on a field trip.


Julie's class came to the hospital on a field trip. They started touring the hospital, but that was derailed when a group of cops came into the ER after a bank robbery. Julie was fascinated by the sight, watching as the doctors started to tend to [[Brett Gibson]], who had been shot in the neck. She stopped watching only when she was led away.

Later, while her class was looking at babies, she asked [[Arizona Robbins]] if the cop died. She knew that he was gurgling blood because he couldn't breathe.

When her class went to leave, Julie left the group and found her way to an OR gallery, where she watched Brett's organ harvest surgery. When Derek found her, he told her she wasn't supposed to be in there, but sat with her and explained some medicine to her as they watched. She said that she wanted to become a doctor when she grows up. When her mother found her, she was happy to see her and gave her a hug.



Julie's mother came along on her field trip to the hospital as a chaperone. When Julie went missing, she was extremely worried.

Julie also told Derek she had a grandfather who had received a heart transplant.


*She wants to be a surgeon when she grows up.

'''June Peterson''' is the mother of [[Charlie Peterson]].


June's son, Charlie, was in the hospital on ECMO after three years awaiting a heart transplant. He was scheduled for a DOR procedure, but before he could have it, a heart became available. He initially refused the heart transplant, fearing that his new heart wouldn't love his boyfriend, [[Henry (Old Scars, Future Hearts)|Henry]], like his old one, but was eventually persuaded to accept it when Henry broke up with him. During his transplant, they discovered that the heart was too large for his chest cavity due to edema. They transplanted the heart anyway and used plastic to wrap his chest cavity while they waited for the swelling to go down so they could close his chest. He was moved to the ICU for observation and Henry came back and regretted having said what he did because he only broke up with Charlie to get him to agree to the surgery.

They operated the next day and were able to close his chest. Charlie woke up and he and Henry reunited.



She is supportive of her son's cosplay and relationship with Henry. She was noticeably shocked when Henry broke up with Charlie and delighted when they got back together.

'''Kate Franklin''' is the mother of [[Lee Franklin]], who was born with esophageal atresia.


Kate's son, Lee, was born with esophageal atresia, which meant that his esophagus was in two pieces. In order for him to be able to eat and grow, they had to attach Foker knobs to his back and turn them each day to stretch his esophagus until the two pieces were close enough to be attached with surgery. He had to be put into a medically-induced coma for this process, meaning that his parents couldn't hold him at all, which was difficult for them.

When the process was almost completed, Alex accidentally turned too hard and disconnected the knobs, which set them back a few days. They had to re-attached the device and continue bringing the pieces closer and closer. Eventually, they were able to take Lee into surgery and attached the two pieces of his esophagus together.



She is married to [[Chase Franklin]]. Together, they have a son, [[Lee Franklin]].


Her son, Lee, was born with esophageal atresia. The treatment for that meant that Kate couldn't hold him until it was finished. After the gap was closed and his esophagus was fixed, she was able to hold her son for the first time.

'''Kathy Elmore''' is a woman who labored and delivered a child at Grey Sloan Memorial.


Kathy came into the hospital in labor, fully dilated. By the time they got her into a bed, she was already crowning. With all the OBs in the hospital busy, nurse [[Terri Akumbu]] pulled Jo Wilson in from the hospital, as hospital rules required a doctor to be present at the delivery. Terri coached Jo through the delivery and then Jo handed the newborn over to his parents. Jake cut the cord and Kathy and Jake happily held their newborn.



She is married to [[Jake Elmore]].


She and her husband have three children, including one born in the middle of the [[COVID- Pandemic]].

'''Kayden Lee''' is a kid who became seriously injured when he put gasoline in the radiator of an overheating car.


Kayden and his friends, [[Conor Jaxtimer]], [[Frankie Morris]], and [[Billie]] were driving to a party when Kayden's car broke down. Billie opened the radiator cap and got burned on their arm. Frankie called for help and Travis and Vic quickly arrived. Vic treated Billie's burn and then they left the kids waiting for a tow. After they left, Kayden, believing he could fix the car, poured gasoline in the radiator, causing an explosion and fire. Conor and Frankie immediately ran away but Billie stayed with Kayden until Travis and Vic came back. They intubated Kayden at the scene and then took him to Grey Sloan, even though Grey Sloan was supposed to be taking only Covid cases. ''("[[Nothing Seems the Same]]")''

In the ER, they started treating his burns. They put in an IO line to start an IV and had to perform an escharotomy to allow his lungs to expand when the burns restricted his chest movement. Once that was done, he was taken to the OR for debridement. After his surgery, he was stable in the ICU and being treated with burn cream. His mother came to visit him, even though it was against the hospital rules. ''("[[All Tomorrow's Parties]]")''

After surgery, Kayden was taken to the ICU, where Jackson continued to treat his burns until he realized his chest burns went all the way down to his lungs. He was rushed back into surgery, but they were unable to save him and he died in the OR. ''("[[The Center Won't Hold]]")''



He was dating someone. ''("[[All Tomorrow's Parties]]")''


His parents, especially his mother, were extremely concerned about him when he was in the hospital. His mother said he was still her baby and still said I love you to her every time he left the house and wouldn't shut the door until she said it back. ''("[[All Tomorrow's Parties]]")''


He is friends with Conor, Frankie, and Billie. They were graduating seniors and upset with graduation and prom being cancelled, so they decided to have a party despite the quarantine in effect. ''("[[Nothing Seems the Same]]")''


*He was newly  at the time of his death.<ref>[[All Tomorrow's Parties]], x</ref>
*His parents insisted on him learning to do his own laundry before he went to college.<ref>[[All Tomorrow's Parties]], x</ref>

She likes a boy named Parker. He'd asked her to go to the spring formal with her.

'''Kimmy''' was a patient at [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]].


Kimmy labored and delivered a child at [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]]. The baby was born with a congenital diaphragmatic hernia. He was intubated so he could breathe. Kimmy kept questioning what was going on while that was happening, echoed by her mother. His SATs were still low, so he was taken to be hooked up to ECMO. Kimmy was most interested in how quickly she'd be able to take the baby home because she was supposed to be at a party her friend Nikki was throwing for her. She declined the chance to see her son, instead going back to her own room. [[Jo Wilson]] found her and her mother getting on the elevator. When she figured out they were planning to leave without Kimmy being discharged, she tried telling them they couldn't leave, then ended up physically fighting with Kimmy's mom. Her efforts failed.



Kimmy's mother was very aggressive in advocating for her daughter, but neither of them expressed interest in staying to take care of Kimmy's son once they discovered he'd be sick for a while.


Kimmy's friend, Nikki, was throwing a party for her to which she was meant to bring her baby.


*She was fifteen when she gave birth to her son.

'''Kristen Rochester''' is an incarcerated teen who was pregnant and needed a surgical procedure.



She grew up on Bainbridge Island and went to an all-girls private school. She remembers her childhood fondly. She had a large play set in the backyard and her mom took her to the beach and did cartwheels. She had a huge room with a TV. Her mom made casseroles.


Kristen was serving  to life in prison when she learned that her baby had a TRAP sequence, meaning that her baby had an acardiac twin putting pressure on her system by requiring her to pump blood to two bodies. With the help of her lawyer, [[Amanda Joseph]], she went to court to get doctors brought in from outside, including fetal surgeon [[Arizona Robbins]], to treat her. When they arrived, she believed they'd be delivering her baby, but she was informed that they were not and were instead doing a procedure to separate the blood vessels connecting her baby to the mass, after which she'd continue her pregnancy. She attacked [[Dominique Eldredge]] for refusing to give her more food, which resulted in her being put into four-point restraints. She was then examined.

Because the baby was hiding the blood vessels Arizona needed to access to separate the mass from the baby, she had to push on Kristen's belly to move her out of the way. During this process, she talked to Kristen to distract her from the pain, telling her about being away from her own daughter, which Jo confirmed was the truth. When Arizona was called away, Jo finished the repositioning and then Arizona started the procedure. Jo told Kristen about her past, and Kristen told her about her own childhood, and that she was naming her daughter Ellie. During the procedure, Kristen sensed that there was something they weren't telling her and began to panic. Despite Arizona's warning that she needed to stay still, she moved around, which caused her water to break and labor to start. She was told that her mother wasn't coming and wouldn't be bringing the baby to see her after she was born. Despite this, they coached her through labor. She initially refused to look at the baby and just told them to take her away, but when she heard the baby crying, she asked to hold her. She held her for a few minutes and told her to be good before handing her over to be adopted by her mother.



She says her mother was a great mom, baking award-winning casseroles and taking her to the beach and sending her to an all-girls private school. Despite this, at some point, she did something for which she was sent to prison. Since she was pregnant, she made arrangements for her mother to adopt the baby. She was devastated to learn that her mother had no plans to see her again and would not be bringing the baby to see her either.


She gets along well with her lawyer, [[Amanda Joseph]]. Amanda is able to calm her down and she trusts Amanda.


*She was sixteen at the time of her pregnancy.
*She was designated K-, which was for especially violent prisoners. She wasn't able to circulate freely with other prisoners for their safety because of it.

'''Laura Eames''' is a patient who was pregnant and had a heart problem.


Laura was  weeks pregnant and had mitral valve insufficiency. She was in the hospital to have a mitral valve repair. Her brother, Todd, came along with her, as he'd support her throughout her entire pregnancy, even when everyone else in her life was against it. While Laura was having her pre-op examinations, she talked to Jo and learned she was a single mother as well. Laura then tried to set Jo up with her brother.

Laura was taken into surgery, but they were unable to complete he procedure because her fetus compressed her aorta, briefly stopping her heart. They were able to stabilize her, but said her surgery would have to be rescheduled. When Laura learned that Jo and Todd had made plans to get drinks together, she raved about Jo to Todd. ''("[[Put the Squeeze On Me]]")''

On the day of Laura's rescheduled surgery, another patient pulled Maggie away, so Teddy stepped in to do Laura's procedure, which went well. After surgery, Todd said she was well enough to tease him, which he took as a good sign. ''("[[Road Trippin']]")''

She later made cookies for Jo and sent them to the hospital with Todd. ''("[[Should I Stay or Should I Go]]")''



She is close with her brother. When she decided to have a baby on her own, despite some health issues, he made a spreadsheet to track all of her symptoms, and offered her the other half of his duplex while she recovered from her mitral valve repair. ''("[[Put the Squeeze On Me]]")''


*She was  at the time of her pregnancy.<ref>[[Put the Squeeze On Me]], x</ref>

'''Lee Franklin''' is a patient who was born with esophageal atresia.


Lee was born with esophageal atresia, which meant that his esophagus was in two pieces. In order for him to be able to eat and grow, they had to attach Foker knobs to his back and turn them each day to stretch his esophagus until the two pieces were close enough to be attached with surgery. He had to be put into a medically-induced coma for this process, meaning that his parents couldn't hold him at all, which was difficult for them.

When the process was almost completed, Alex accidentally turned too hard and disconnected the knobs, which set them back a few days. They had to re-attached the device and continue bringing the pieces closer and closer. Eventually, they were able to take Lee into surgery and attached the two pieces of his esophagus together.



His parents were with him in the hospital. It was hard on his mother not to be able to hold him after he was born.


He started the Foker process when he was just one day old.

'''Liam Hayes''' is the oldest son of [[Cormac Hayes]].



[[File:xAbigailHayesDeath.png|thumb|The boys spend time with their dying mother.]]
Liam's mom developed cancer after a tumor in her uterus, believed to be a fibroid, was macerated, spreading the cancer cells throughout her body. She underwent treatment, including two clinical trials, but they were unsuccessful and she died. After she died, they gathered up her things from her hospital room and sat in the empty room together for a while before going home. ''("[[Love of My Life]]")''


Liam came to the hospital with his brother, Austin, on a day when the schools were closed due to parent-teacher conferences. ''("[[Save the Last Dance for Me]]")''


Liam and his brother went along with their father to LA for a conference as their aunt lived there and it gave them the chance to visit her. ''("[[Love of My Life]]")''


During the [[COVID- Pandemic]], Irene moved to Seattle to help Cormac care for Austin and Liam. ''("[[Breathe]]")''

Following the death of George Floyd, Liam and Austin painted signs and went to the protests with their father. While they were protesting, one of the counter-protesters, a Nazi, came at one of them with a billy club. Cormac got between them and took a blow to the head, so they left to go to the hospital so he could be treated. Cormac then sent his sons home, barring them from attending any more protests. However, after a day of work and treating [[Nell Timms]], Cormac went home and told his sons that he believed the work they were doing was important and they should be part of it, but only during the daytime and only while he was there. ''("[[Sign O' the Times]]")''


Liam and Austin went to San Diego over Thanksgiving to spend the holiday with their aunt. ''("[[Everyday Is a Holiday (With You)]]")''


Liam moved back to Ireland with his father and brother. ''("[[Living In a House Divided]]")''



His mother died two years prior to his move to Seattle.

'''Lisa Lefkowitz''' is the mother of [[Oliver Lefkowitz]].


Lisa's son, Oliver, had gastroparesis and was said to have been an epic puker for a long time, which left him unable to eat solid food. He was in the hospital to have adhesions removed and to have a gastric neurostimulator implanted to shock his stomach to remind it to digest his food.

In surgery, [[Jo Wilson]] accidentally perforated his stomach, but [[Alex Karev]] was able to repair the damage and the operation was successful.



She is married to [[Rob Lefkowitz]], with whom she has a son, [[Oliver Lefkowitz]].


She has one son, [[Oliver Lefkowitz]], who was hospitalized with gastroparesis.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Lefkowtiz, Lisa}}

'''Logan Treadwell''' was a patient at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].


Logan was cut on the arm while composting. He refused a tetanus shot when it happened. He came into the hospital when he developed rictus sardonicus. He again refused treatment for tetanus, calling it poison and saying that [[Jo Wilson|Dr. Wilson]] was a puppet for Big Pharma.

His condition worsened and his abdomen was rigid, but he still refused treatment for tetanus. Then his arm spasmed and broke. He was taken into surgery after scans revealed a previous break that hadn't healed properly. They had to re-break his arm in order to re-align the bone so it would heal properly.

After surgery, his brother asked for a list of all the materials they'd used, amused that they'd put so much into his brother's organic, grass-fed body.



Father
Logan and Abraham's father died when they were young, done in by corn beef hash and cigarettes. Since his death, Logan has become obsessed with what he puts into his body, even medical treatments.

[[Abraham Treadwell]]
Logan is close with his brother, Abraham, to the point where Abraham came to be with him when he was hospitalized. After surgery, Abraham requested a list of all the materials they'd used in surgery.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Treadwell, Logan}}
