'''Luna Wilson''' is the daughter of [[Jo Wilson]], who was born to her late patient [[Val Ashton]].



Luna was born at  weeks' gestation after spending those  weeks growing outside her mother's uterus on her liver. She was the result of a one-night stand her mother had following her divorce. After she was born, she wasn't breathing or moving, so she was quickly intubated and then taken to the NICU, where she was stable. ''("[[My Happy Ending]]")''

After her birth, Luna was put on a ventilator as she continued to grow and develop. Her mother spoke to her over the phone as much as she was able to. ''("[[Fight the Power]]")''

Luna developed a bronchogenic cyst, which required surgery to remove. When they told Val that Luna needed surgery, she was upset because Luna had not been able to be held in her whole life and she was worried Luna was scared and confused. Jo promise she'd bring Luna to see her before her surgery, but before she could, Val coded and eventually died while Luna was in surgery. Luna's surgery went well and she was stable in the NICU afterward. Jo sat with her and held her hand. ''("[[Helplessly Hoping]]")''

Jo continued visiting Luna in the NICU and holding her. ''("[[Breathe]]")''

Bailey and Cormac also began visiting Luna and talking to her about the outside world. Jo became convinced she was reacting to the sound of her own name. ''("[[Sorry Doesn't Always Make It Right]]")''

Inspired by a patient telling his great-granddaughter the story of her family, Jo visited Luna in the NICU and told her about her mother and how every time Jo entered the ER, she thought of Val and of Luna. ''("[[Tradition]]")''

The weeks she'd spent intubated left Luna with very little gag reflex. She started spitting up after every feed and experienced drops in her heart rate each time. Her newly-assigned legal guardian, [[Carmen Delgado]], came to the hospital to check on her and Cormac told Carmen he was going to run labs to confirm a diagnosis of gastroesophageal reflux. A week later, the diagnosis was confirmed, so they tried sitting her upright for feedings and giving her smaller amounts more frequently. When her condition worsened, Cormac proposed a Nissen fundoplication to stop the reflux. However, her social worker and legal guardian would not consent to the surgery. ''("[[I'm Still Standing]]")''

Later, Carmen changed her mind and allowed Luna to have the surgery, which went well. When Carmen mentioned that she had a family in mind who wanted to foster to adopt Luna, Jo decided she needed to get a lawyer and fight for custody of Luna. She had Link and Amelia temporarily foster Luna while she worked with the lawyer to get her record cleared and her adoption approved, to keep anyone else from adopting her. Finally, in April , Jo was able to take Luna home with her. ''("[[Someone Saved My Life Tonight]]")''


On the day she was supposed to return to work, Jo took Luna to the hospital. However, she ended up spending the entire day in the hospital parking lot, unable to take Luna in to the daycare. She worried Luna was feeling the same sense of abandonment Jo felt when her mother left her at the fire station as an infant. ''("[[Here Comes the Sun]]")''

Despite this initial hiccup, Luna did eventually start attending the daycare while her mother worked. ''("[[Some Kind of Tomorrow]]")''


On Thanksgiving, Luna went to a small celebration in the hospital cafeteria with her mom, Nico, Levi, Richard, and Bailey. ''("[[Everyday Is a Holiday (With You)]]")''


Wanting to give Luna all the experiences she never got to have, Jo planned to take Luna to fairytale theater in the park with Link and Scout. As they arrived at the park, she started explaining everything to Luna, saying she'd read that talking to your baby was important. They watched as the show started. One of the stories, Rapunzel, was interrupted when the actor playing the prince, [[Jeremy (Today Was a Fairytale)|Jeremy]], had a sudden cardiac episode and fell. Jo and Link rushed to his aid. Luna started fussing, so Jo had one of the actors move her closer and talked to her while she worked. When [[Janice (Today Was a Fairytale)|Janice]] started singing Someday My Prince Will Come to her, Jo said she wasn't sure that was the message she wanted for Luna, but thanked her. Luna later went with Jo to the hospital to follow up on Jeremy. ''("[[Today Was a Fairytale]]")''


Jo took Luna to the park for a play date with [[Pruitt Arike Miller|Pru]]. ''("[[Wasn't Expecting That]]")''


On Halloween, Jo took Luna trick or treating at the hospital. She wore a dog costume. ''("[[Haunted]]")''



Her birth mother, Val, wanted a child for a long time before she was born. When she found out she was pregnant, even though she was at high risk for bleeding, she was happy. Not long after she was born, her father signed over his rights to her, then her mother died. ''("[[Helplessly Hoping]]")'' After Val died, Jo began spending more time with Luna and eventually adopted her. ''("[[Someone Saved My Life Tonight]]")''


*Her birth mother knew what her name would be from the time she was herself a young girl.
*She only likes two songs.<ref>[[Legacy]], x</ref>
*Her favorite book is "Where's My Belly Button?"<ref>[[Legacy]], x</ref>

'''Lynne Gagliano''' is a cancer patient who had a heart attack during her tumor resection.


Lynne had been diagnosed with esophageal cancer. She was in the hospital to have her tumor removed. However, when she learned that April would be doing her surgery instead of Meredith, she tried to refuse as she trusted Meredith. However, her surgery was fairly emergent, so she was told she really couldn't postpone it. During her surgery, she had a heart attack and when she woke up afterward, she was disappointed to learn that they hadn't removed the cancer. She blamed April for that. Later, she had trouble breathing due to gastric acid in her lungs caused by the staples April had put in to close her not holding. April rushed her back into surgery and repaired the damage. She was also able to remove Lynne's tumor. When Lynne woke up after surgery, she was delighted that the cancer was gone.



She had a good relationship with [[Meredith Grey]]. Meredith diagnosed her cancer, held her hand, and was supposed to operate on it. She tried to postpone her surgery when she learned that Meredith wasn't available.


*She's been going to the same hairstylist for  years.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Gagliano, Lynne}}

'''Marcia Archibald''' is the wife of [[Thomas Archibald]], whose penis she cut off.


Marcia, upset to find that her husband, Thomas, was having an affair with his sous-chef, [[Rory Petrucci]], took a sharp knife and used it to cut his penis off, which she then placed in a pot at Rory's station. Rory retrieved the penis and took Thomas to the hospital, where they operated to reattach his severed penis.

When Marcia arrived at the hospital after his surgery, the doctors called security, but he informed them that he had called her and he was going to forgive her.



She is married to [[Thomas Archibald]]. They have an arrangement wherein he is allowed to sleep with waitresses and hostesses, but when he slept with [[Rory Petrucci]], his sous-chef, he broke their agreement and she cut off his penis. Despite this, he forgave her and they stayed together.


Marcia is a restaurateur. She owns a restaurant called Archibald's, where her husband, Thomas, is the chef.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Archibald, Marcia}}

'''Marcy''' is a teacher whose class came to the hospital on a field trip.


Marcy brought  fifth graders on a field trip to the hospital to take a tour. While they were touring, a group of cops came in after a bank robbery resulted in three of them being shot. This derailed the kids' tour and they abruptly left the ER so the kids wouldn't see the injured cops. Marcy tried to get ahold of the bus driver to take the kids back to the school, but when she couldn't, the kids were taken to see the babies instead. Then [[Alex Karev]] showed them a scan of a patient who had a nail in his head and another with a coffee can in his abdomen. Marcy came in just as they were looking at that and said that the bus driver was back to take them back to school. She was upset that Alex showed them the picture of the coffee can.

As they went to leave the hospital, one of the students, [[Julie Hamilton]] went missing. They eventually found her in an OR gallery.


Marcy is a fifth grade teacher. She took her class to the hospital on a field trip.

{{DISPLAYTITLE:Marcy}}

'''Marie Mercer''' is the wife of [[Donald Mercer]], a patient at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].



Marie came to the hospital after her husband, Donald, was in a car accident. She waited, crying, at the registration desk as the doctors attempted to resuscitate him. When the doctors informed her that Donald was brain dead, she signed the papers to donate his organs, but asked to have a minute with him. However, before his organs could be harvested, he suffered cardiac death.



[[Donald Mercer]]
She was married to Donald Mercer until his death.

'''Marion''' is the mother of [[Diamond]].


Marion came to the hospital when she learned her daughter had collapsed in pain during a sexual educate presentation. Over the phone, she told them that it was probably just cramps as Diamond had a history of bad cramps during her period. When she arrived, she learned that Diamond actually had a large ovarian cyst and an ovarian torsion, both of which were treated surgically. Marion felt guilty for simply attributing the pain to bad cramps, but the doctors assured her she couldn't have known without proper training. They also told her Diamond would be fine and they had been able to preserve both of her ovaries.



She came to the hospital when her daughter had surgery.

{{DISPLAYTITLE:Marion}}

NASA |only appearance = [[Caught Somewhere in Time]] |seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] |portrayed by = [[Laura San Giacomo]] }} '''Marjorie Kersey''' is a former astronaut who was injured when an electromagnet fell on her. Marjorie was working on creating a machine that could take her forward in time when a large electromagnet fell on her. Her injuries were initially treated at a community health center in Spokane, but four days later, she was transferred to Grey Sloan Memorial due to persistent abdominal pain. When she talked about trying to make a time machine, they did a head CT in addition to an abdominal CT. The head CT didn't show anything abnormal, but the abdominal CT showed a fistula between her liver and duodenum. She also had an abscess in her chest, but Maggie said it could be treated easily during her surgery. They took her into surgery, but there was unexpected bleeding. They weren't able to stop the bleeding and she was pronounced dead in the OR. She was an astronaut with NASA. After leaving NASA, she worked on creating a device to travel forward in time. *She was at the time of her death. *She logged over hours in space as an astronaut. *She won the Fundamental Physics Prize twice. *[[Miranda Bailey]] was a fan of hers. {{DEFAULTSORT:Kersey, Marjorie}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:GA Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:Deceased Characters]] [[Category:Patients]] [[Category:Patients (General)]] [[Category:Patients (Trauma)]] [[Category:Patients (Renal)]]

'''Max Spencer''' is a child who had a malrotation of his intestine.


Max had been diagnosed with malrotation of his intestine due to abdominal bands. Before his surgery, he met his surgeon, Jo Wilson. He was shocked to see that she looked like Allora the Warrior Queen from his comic book and was excited to have her operate on him. Despite a pair of glasses falling in his body cavity, his surgery went well.


*He was seven at the time of his surgery.

'''Micah''' is [[Lily (Hotter Than Hell)|Lily's]] friend.


Micah and Lily met online. They wanted to meet in person, but her parents were opposed. Lily ended up meeting him secretly, but became injured when she fell off a jet ski and the stream of water ripped through her pelvis. Micah went to the hospital to check on her, but wouldn't help the doctors when they said they needed to call her parents, as he said she didn't want her parents to know. After Lily's surgery, Cormac talked to Micah from the perspective of a parent of a teenager and convinced Micah to unlock Lily's phone so they could call her parents.



He and Lily met online. When they wanted to meet in real life, her parents were opposed so they did it secretly.

'''Michael Nelson''' is the husband of [[Adrian Nelson]].



Michael's wife, Adrian, was diagnosed with a leiomyosarcoma. Before surgery, Adrian had her doctors swear on "The book," a copy of ''The Odyssey,'' that they would do their best work. They took her in for what should have been a straight-forward tumor resection, but when they got in there, they realized the tumor had grown quickly, wrapping around her heart and making their scans useless. They did a temporary abdominal closure and got new scans so they could develop a new surgical plan. When they saw that scans weren't enough, they printed a D rendering of the tumor to help them visualize the anatomy. With that, they began to develop a new surgical plan. However, while they were developing their new plan, Adrian started bleeding, so she had to be taken back into surgery immediately. They followed the plan they had developed up to the point where they hadn't planned anymore and then they had to make up a plan as they operated. They did so successfully and removed the whole tumor.



Michael is married to [[Adrian Nelson]]. They met when Adrian came into the shop where Michael sells rare books and bought a copy of ''The Odyssey''. They were both interested in each other, but too shy to ask the other out, so Michael wrote his number on a bookmark, where Adrian found it when she got home. She called right away and they've been together ever since.


Michael sells rare books.


*He and Adrian consider the copy of ''The Odyssey'' she bought from him to be like their wedding rings.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Nelson, Michael}}

'''Michelle Curtis''' is a police officer who came in the hospital after a bank robbery.



Michelle came into the ER with the other cops when three of them were shot in a bank robbery. She was not injured in the robbery.


When [[Julie Hamilton]] went missing from her school group, her mother and the other chaperones spoke to Michelle, giving her a description of Julie so they could start to look for her.



She seems to have a good professional relationship with the three cops who were injured in the bank robbery: [[Dan Pruitt]], [[Brett Gibson]], and [[Peter Gibson]]. She stayed at the hospital while they were being treated.


Michelle is a police officer in Seattle.

'''Mr. Davis''' is the father of [[Taryn Davis]], a patient at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].



His daughter was hospitalized with stomach pain and vomiting on Halloween. It was discovered that she contracted an infection when she went to Brazil on a business trip with her father.



[[Taryn Davis]]
He has a daughter, Taryn. He cares deeply about his daughter, though he can be an inattentive father, as evidenced by the fact that he didn't notice when she wandered out of the ER at the hospital. After her collapse, he said he never would have let her watch the scary movie if he had known and Jo assures him that he's a good dad.


He is very dedicated to his work and even continued to take business calls while his daughter was in the hospital. During one of these calls, she left the ER without him noticing.

'''Mr. Donovan''' is the father of [[Jaylen Donovan]].


After three years of dialysis to treat her kidney failure, a kidney became available for Jaylen, Mr. Donovan's daughter. When Alex went with Jaylen's parents to tell her about the kidney, they found her kissing her boyfriend, [[Thelonious|Theo]].

While Alex was reviewing the post-transplant meds she'd need to take afterward, she became upset upon hearing some of the potential side effects and locked herself in a bathroom. Alex went down to the dialysis area and took Theo's phone in order to text Jaylen. She came out to say she knew it was Alex texting, but she agreed to speak with him only if he'd come into the bathroom with her. She tried to get him to put off the transplant as she wasn't ready, but he talked her into accepting the transplant, saying she needs to take the good things when they're in front of her. She agreed and the transplant went on as scheduled.



He is married to [[Mrs. Donovan]] and together, they have a daughter, [[Jaylen Donovan]].


His daughter, Jaylen, was in kidney failure for three years before a transplant became available for her.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Donovan, Mr.}}

'''Mrs. Gibson''' is the mother of [[Peter Gibson|Pete]] and [[Brett Gibson]], two cops who were shot during a bank robbery.



At some point prior to the shooting, Mrs. Gibson held a pot luck dinner for the guys on the force. Pete told her that when all of the shooting stuff was over, they needed to do it again and invite the doctors to it.


Both of Mrs. Gibson's sons, Pete and Brett, responded when a bank was robbed at gunpoint. They were brought into the hospital and she was told that they were both stable. Brett was taken into surgery, so she stayed with Pete and talked to him while he was waiting to go to surgery. However, he arrested while he was waiting. They were able to restore a heartbeat, but he'd been without oxygen for  minutes and he was declared brain dead. Brett's surgery went well, but just as they were finishing, he threw a clot and had a stroke, leaving him brain dead as well. Mrs. Gibson was left having to choose whether to donate Pete and Brett's organs. She said they would want to help people, so she agreed to donate, but backed out when [[Miranda Bailey|Bailey]] asked her to do a directed donation of Brett's liver to Jared, one of the suspects in the bank robbery. However, after [[Dan Pruitt]] spoke to her about Jared, a  year old he had Brett had been trying to get back on the right path, she agreed to allow them to take Brett's liver. After the organ harvesting was over, she was given a list of  people who got a second chance today because of her sons, the recipients of their organs. Jackson then worked on her son's bodies to make them look as good as possible for her when she saw them for the last time.



She had two sons, Brett and Pete, who were both police officers. They were both declared brain dead after being shot during a bank robbery and she had to make the difficult choice to donate their organs.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Gibson, Mrs.}}

'''Nell Timms''' is a woman who was impaled on a tear gas canister at the protests.



When Nell was , her mother took her to the March on Washington to see Martin Luther King, Jr. give his famous I Have a Dream speech. As an adult, she mainly remembered that it was hot and that her mother took her to cool off her feet in the Reflecting Pool.


Nell spent much of her life protesting, including in Ferguson, in response to the death of Michael Brown, and at Standing Rock, protesting the Dakota Access Pipeline. After the death of George Floyd, she protested in Seattle. During this protest, she was hit with a tear gas canister fired at close range. She was taken to the hospital, where they removed the canister in surgery after determining that it had only torn through muscle and hadn't hit any major vessels. After her surgery, she was told they'd go back in in a few days to close her up more neatly so her scarring would be minimal, but she showed them her other scars and said it would just go along with them. They also said she'd need physical therapy to regain complete range of motion.


*She tore her ACL running from a tank in Ferguson and got frostbite on her hand at Standing Rock.

'''Nick''' went along with his sister's class as a chaperone when they went on a field trip to the hospital.


Nick went along on a field trip to the hospital with his sister's fifth grade class as a chaperone. When he went to the bathroom, the group moved on, leaving him lost and alone. He enlisted the help of [[Stephanie Edwards]] to find the class. They caught up with the group and he and Stephanie spent the day talking as they took the kids around.

At the end of the day, when they were getting ready to leave, Stephanie found him again and asked him out. However, he then told her he was still in high school, leaving her shocked.



While he was chaperoning a field trip to the hospital, he spent the day talking with [[Stephanie Edwards]]. Unaware of how young he was, she asked him out on a date at the end of the day. She was shocked to learn that he's still in high school.


He has a younger sister who is in fifth grade.


*His little sister is in [[Marcy (When I Grow Up)|Marcy's]] class along with [[Julie Hamilton]] and [[AJ]].

*He chaperoned because he figured it would look good on his college application.

'''Niki''' is a woman who came to the hospital in labor and gave birth.


Niki was with her boyfriend of four weeks, [[Dustin]], when she went into labor. He was surprised as he hadn't known she was pregnant, despite her belief that it was obvious. When they arrived at the hospital, Niki was told she was five centimeters dilated. She explained that she'd gotten pregnant during a hookup, but decided to continue the pregnancy anyway, despite a lack of support from those around her. While she labored, Dustin decided to leave, saying he wasn't prepared to be a dad. Niki had some chest pain, but the EKG was normal, so they attributed the pain to anxiety. Niki then continued her labor alone. When she neared the birth, Niki grabbed Jo's hand and wouldn't let go, forcing her to page Carina. When Carina arrived, she reminded Jo of her role as a doctor. Jo then took over the delivery, which was complicated by shoulder dystocia. Despite this, she was able to deliver her son and held him after he was born.



She had been dating [[Dustin]], whom she met on a dating app, for four weeks when she gave birth. He left her in the hospital because he was unprepared to be a parent.


When she got pregnant from a hookup, her parents told her they wanted no part of it.


Her friends thought she was crazy for having a random guy's baby.

'''Nina Sullivan''' is a woman who came to the hospital specifically for Meredith after reading about her.


After reading about Meredith, Nina came to Grey Sloan Memorial to see her specifically and refused to leave until she did. Bailey went to see her, as Meredith wasn't working, and convinced Nina to let her work on her case as she had been Meredith's teacher. Nina had been having severe abdominal pain and the doctors hadn't been able to discover a cause. Bailey and Jo worked strategically, testing everything they could. At the end of the day, the tests had revealed nothing. Nina refused to accept that and said they needed to work harder. Then she ate her sandwich, which she had packed to eat after her tests, because she was always hungry from fasting for blood work. Soon after, she started writhing in pain. Bailey performed an ultrasound, which revealed that she had a ligament wrapped around her celiac artery, which expanded when she ate, causing the pain. They scheduled surgery to cut the ligament for the next day.



She inherited an auto shop from her father when he retired after  years. He taught her everything she knows about cars and also gave her his lunch pail.


She is a mechanic. She inherited her father's auto shop when he retired.


*Before coming to Grey Sloan, she saw an internist, two gastroenterologists, and two surgeons who couldn't figure out her problem.

'''Officer Buckner''' is an officer who responded when a cult leader threatened to jump from a roof.


Officer Buckner and his partner, [[Officer Garza]], responded to the call when [[Warren Sterman]] reported that cult leader [[Brother John]] was on the roof of a building and threatening to jump, believing he could fly. When they arrived, they tried to talk him down off the roof, but were unsuccessful. On the ground, one of the followers [[Gideon]], was injured, but resisting medical care. Officer Buckner tried to help corral him, but ended up being grabbed. Buckner managed to push him off. Next, Garza said they were going to shut the music off, but Andy said she wanted to let Jack keep trying to get John to come down on his own. Despite this, John soon after jumped off the roof, but landed on an air bag the firefighters had placed there. Buckner held back cult members as John was taken to the aid car.


He is a police officer with the Seattle Metropolitan Police Department.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Buckner, Officer}}

'''Officer Schneider''' is a police officer who responded when [[Robert Corson]] reported people in his front yard.


Officer Schneider and his partner, [[Officer Wicklund]], came to the house of [[Robert Corson|Bob Corson]] after Bob called to report trespassers on his property, namely [[Joyce Williams]] and several off-duty firefighters. Joyce had been on his front lawn for some time because she had tracked her daughter's fitness watch to his house and believed he'd kidnapped her and her friend and was holding them in his house. When Wicklund and Schneider arrived on the scene, Joyce and the firefighters believed they were responding to the calls for help, but they quickly made it clear they were responding to Bob's calls, not theirs, which had gone ignored. They refused to help Joyce, believing she just couldn't keep track of her kid. Dean pretended to smell a gas leak in order to get access to the house, but Bob still refused to let them in. However, they heard glass breaking and discovered a basement window had been blown out by fire. Sullivan and Dean went inside and retrieved the girls while Bob was arrested, though he continued to claim he was innocent.

Schneider stood by the ambulance while Shanice was treated before being sent to the hospital. When she admitted that she and Jada had started the fire to lure rescue, he then went to Jada and tried to question her after Wicklund had already asked her insensitively what had happened in the basement. When Bob claimed the girls had broken into his house and started a fire, Schneider seemed to believe this to be true and implied that girls like Jada and Shanice lie all the time. When he said this, Joyce lunged at him, though Maya grabbed her by the waist and pulled her back before she made contact. Despite this, Joyce was arrested for assaulting a police officer. When Dean tried to stop this arrested, he was tackled to the ground and arrested himself. Andy jumped in to try to stop Dean's arrest and was shoved to the ground. Sullivan saw this happen and shoved the cop who shoved Andy, which led to him also being arrested at gunpoint. Joyce, Dean, and Sullivan were then put into cop cars and taken away.


He is a police officer with the Seattle Metropolitan Police Department.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Schneider, Officer}}

When Dean tried to stop this arrested, he was tackled to the ground and arrested himself. Andy jumped in to try to stop Dean's arrest and was shoved to the ground. Sullivan saw this happen and shoved the cop who shoved Andy, which led to him also being arrested at gunpoint. Joyce, Dean, and Sullivan were then put into cop cars and taken away. ''("[[Out of Control]]")''

He was later present at the police station when Maya went to get them released from police custody. ''("[[Train in Vain]]")''

When Station  responded to a cult leader standing on his roof and threatening to jump, Wicklund was part of the police response to the same call. When he saw Dean at the site, he tried to apologize, saying he'd reported Schneider later and Schneider was suspended pending an investigation. Dean pointed out that he still stood by while Schneider arrested two innocent Black men.

Later, after [[Brother John|John]] was in the aid car, Wicklund said he had questions for him as there were outstanding warrants for his arrest. Travis asked if they could wait until he got to the hospital as they needed to leave and Wicklund said they could. ''("[[Learning to Fly]]")''


He is a police officer with the Seattle Metropolitan Police Department.

'''Oliver Lefkowitz''' was a patient at [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]] who had a gastric neurostimulator implanted to treat gastroparesis.


Oliver had gastroparesis and was said to have been an epic puker for a long time, which left him unable to eat solid food. He was in the hospital to have adhesions removed and to have a gastric neurostimulator implanted to shock his stomach to remind it to digest his food.

In surgery, [[Jo Wilson]] accidentally perforated his stomach, but [[Alex Karev]] was able to repair the damage and the operation was successful.



Oliver came into the hospital with his parents, [[Rob Lefkowitz|Rob]] and [[Lisa Lefkowitz|Lisa]].


He was  at the time of his hospitalization.

'''Oscar Hallis''' was a patient at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] who was injured in the mudslide caused by the Super Storm.


Oscar Hallis was brought in to the hospital with injuries from the mudslide, including a probable concussion. The primary concern, however, was infection, as he had a large laceration on his leg. Alex went to give him ampicillin, but Jo stopped him, saying that Oscar is allergic to penicillin, which she learned from the markings on his leg, which listed his vitals. They gave him cefazolin instead. They got him a head CT, which was clear, and he regained consciousness. Since the electronic charts were down, they continued documenting his vitals on his body and told him that someone from plastics would come stitch up his leg.

Despite the laceration on his leg, Oscar walked around and ended up sitting by [[Sasha (Season )|Sasha's]] bed. She noticed the vitals on his leg and said the handwriting looked like [[Brian (Season )|Brian's]], but Oscar wasn't sure.


He is a first responder who was part of the evacuation efforts following the Super Storm and mudslide.


*He wears glasses, which he lost in the storm.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Hallis, Oscar}}

Pablo was in the hospital receiving fluids in the morning in preparation for his chemotherapy that afternoon.


With Alex, Pablo started pranking Jason Myers, paging him all over the hospital where there were no patients for him to see. After a while, they upgraded to paging him for patients with embarrassing names (such as "Jenny Talia"). When [[Richard Webber]] found out what they were doing, he encouraged them to ramp it up again and they got Jason to pee in a cup and deliver it to [[Miranda Bailey]] for drug testing.



While hospitalized, he developed a crush on [[Jo Wilson]]. This crush inspired him to pull pranks on [[Jason Myers]] with [[Alex Karev]].

|name = Parker Hedges
|status = Alive
|diagnosis = Kawasaki Disease
|doctors = [[Meredith Grey]]
|treatment = Intravenous Immunoglobulin
|parents = [[Casey Hedges]]
|only appearance = [[Can't Fight This Feeling]]
|seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season  (Grey's Anatomy)|]]
|portrayed by = [[Kaine Reid|Kaine]], [[Hunter Reid|Hunter]], and [[Raedin Reid]]
}}
'''Parker Hedges''' is the son of [[Casey Hedges]]. He was admitted to [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] when his mother suspected he had Kawasaki Disease.



Casey Hedges came to the ER with her son, Parker Hedges. She approached Jo Wilson and said they were in the hospital the other night. Jo remember them and asked if Parker was still sick. Casey informed Jo that Parker's fever went down at first, but it spiked again later and she showed her the rash on his belly. Jo asked if Casey gave her son\uathe meds and lots of fluids. Casey said she did, but that his fever was still above , which it had been for over a week. Jo tried to assure her that it was a virus and that it was normal for the fever to last more than  days. Casey then pulled out a bunch of papers, saying she did some online research. Jo rapidly looked at them, but didn't seem convinced. Casey told her she knew her son and that she was sure it wasn't a virus. Jo then agreed to give them a chart.

Meanwhile, Casey accosted Meredith, giving her some names of illnesses she found on the Internet. Jo then came over and told them it was strep, giving them a prescription for amoxicillin. Casey was relieved it wasn't a virus and left with Parker.

However, some time later, Casey returned to the ER with her son. She told a nurse the fever was getting higher, which didn't make any sense. When Jo came to talk to her, Casey said it wasn't strep and that whatever Jo prescribed wasn't helping. Jo tried to calm her down, saying the meds would take  hours to work, but Casey said that he wouldn't have gotten worse if they did. Casey said Jo was dismissing them, just like the doctors at\ua[[Seattle Presbyterian Hospital]]\uaand Urgent Care. Jo looked startled and asked her if she really had been to all those hospitals. Casey said she did, but that she wanted another doctor because Jo either didn't believe her or she didn't care about her son.

After that, Jo got a psychiatrist to talk to Casey. She started screaming at Jo about her thinking she was crazy. She desperately told them that her son didn't do anything anymore, when Meredith overheard her talking. She came over and told Casey she believed her. She told Jo to admit Parker.

In his room, Meredith said his [[Computed Tomography|CT]] was completely normal. Meredith then patiently overheard all of Casey's research, but none of them seemed to be the one. Meredith said she couldn't come up with anything other than strep, but Casey replied he should've gotten better if it was. Meredith said she'd do some more tests.


The morning after, Meredith told Casey she couldn't find anything else than the strep, that he wasn't surgical, and that his labs kept coming back clean. Casey insisted she had a feeling that something was seriously wrong with her son.

Right before discharging Parker, Meredith and Jo went through Parker's labs one last time. Suddenly, the labs were updated. The previous day's strep test was a false positive. Meredith then realized Parker had Kawasaki disease. She checked her calendar to look if ten days had passed since the fever started. It turned out to be the tenth day. Meredith then ran over to Parker's room to check if he had red eyes.

After she found out he did, she told Jo to page peds and cardio and to start IVIG. She told Casey that Parker had Kawasaki disease and it was the last day they would be able to prevent permanent heart damage.

In the evening, Meredith showed Casey her son's echo. She informed her that the IVIG would fix the fluid around his heart. She added that Parker would need another echo in six months and after showing Casey's note on Kawasaki disease, she smilingly told Casey that she had fought for her son and saved his life. Meredith later walked by their room, where Parker showed his mother a drawing with crayons he made for her.



[[Casey Hedges]]
Parker's mother, Casey, was highly concerned about his illness. She took him to multiple hospitals and clinics in search for an answer. When she finally got one and he started treatment, she was delighted to see him more active again.


*He goes out to the porch every morning to get the paper as his big-kid chore.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Hedges, Parker}}

'''Patricia Cole''' is the mother of [[Brandon Cole]].


Patricia came to the hospital along with [[Danielle Green]] when the police called them and said that one of their sons had been shot. They hadn't been told which kid it was, so they were desperate to find out. Patricia was horrified to learn that it was her son, Brandon. When they saw [[Stacy]], the babysitter, at the hospital, they asked her what happened and she told them that the kids had found Patricia's gun and [[Peter Green|Peter]] had accidentally shot Brandon.

Brandon had no reflexes in his feet, indicating paralysis, so he was taken into surgery. During the surgery, Patricia was offered the choice between a brace to stabilize his back or spinal decompression, both of which could lead to permanent paralysis. She chose the spinal decompression at Amelia's recommendation, but while Amelia was working, they were forced to defibrillate, moving Brandon's body and undoing that work, leaving him paralyzed.

After surgery, Patricia and Ron were told that Brandon would have physical and occupational therapy to regain some function, but he'd never walk again.



She is married to [[Ron Cole]].


Her son, Brandon, was shot by his friend, Peter, using her gun, leaving him paralyzed.

'''Patricia Phillips''' is a patient who had a very large brain tumor.


Patricia had a brain tumor. When she was diagnosed, she started calling her tumor Wilma after the woman her husband was having an affair with. The tumor finally convinced her to leave her husband. She came to the hospital to have it removed. They did pre-op labs and shaved her head in preparation for the surgery.



She was married for over  years to a preacher. He had an affair, but she stayed because she worried about him losing his congregation if they found out. She eventually left him when her tumor was diagnosed and she realized she needed to start looking out for herself, to be brave.

'''Pete Hover''' is a kid who was injured when he fell out of a hot air balloon.


Pete wanted to ask [[Jamie Hall]] to go to the homecoming dance with him, so he planned an elaborate invitation, involving a hot air balloon and him wearing a tuxedo. However, the landing of the hot air balloon went badly and he ended up in the hospital with abdominal trauma and a broken leg as well as flash burns to his arms. His burns were debrided in the ER and then he was taken into surgery. After surgery, Jamie was told he would have to use a wheelchair or maybe crutches, but he could still go to homecoming. After some thought, Jamie decided to accept his invitation.



He likes [[Jamie Hall]] and decided to ask her to homecoming. Despite an accident when he asked her, she ultimately said yes.


*He was sixteen at the time of his accident.
*He worked two jobs to afford the "Ho-Co-Pro" (homecoming proposal).

'''Peter Gibson''' is a police officer who came into the hospital after being shot during a bank robbery.



When he and his brother, Brett, were kids, Pete used to follow Brett around, doing whatever he was doing. However, his mother said he eventually found his own way.


Some time before the shooting, Pete's mother hosted a pot luck for all the officers. While he was being treated in the ER, he told his mother they needed to hold another one and invite the doctors.


Pete, along with his brother, [[Brett Gibson|Brett]], and [[Dan Pruitt]], responded to a call when a bank was being robbed at gunpoint. All three of them were shot. Pete was shot in the chest and abdomen. He had blood in his chest, so they started chest tubes and prepared him to be taken into surgery. He was awake and able to speak with his mother for a while before he had a traumatic arrest. They were able to restore his heartbeat, but he'd been without oxygen for  minutes and he was declared brain dead. After his mother consented, his organs were donated for transplant. Once his organ harvest surgery was completed, [[Jackson Avery]] worked on his body to make it look as good as possible for when his mom came to see him one last time.



Pete has a brother, Brett, who also died as a result of injuries sustained during the bank robbery. They were both close with their mother, who was devastated to lose both her sons in the same day.


Peter was a police officer in [[Seattle]].

{{DEFAULTSORT:Gibson, Peter}}

'''Peter Green''' is the friend of [[Brandon Cole]], whom he accidentally shot.


Peter was playing at his friend, Brandon's, house when they found Brandon's mom's gun and started playing with it. Peter accidentally used the gun to shoot Brandon in the abdomen. Both boys were taken to the ER, where Brandon was in critical condition with signs of paralysis. Peter worried that he had killed his friend.

After Brandon's surgery, he was left paralyzed. Amelia came to Peter and told him that any time he felt bad about what happened, to tell himself it was an accident and he didn't mean to hurt his friend.



Peter's mom came to the hospital when she thought he'd been shot. She was relieved to find out that Brandon was actually the one who was shot.


He and [[Brandon Cole]] are friends. While they were playing, they found Brandon's mom's gun, which Peter accidentally shot Brandon with.


*He was eight at the time of the shooting.

'''Ralph Tennyson''' is a man who brought [[Truman Cole]] to the hospital after he was separated from his mother.


Ralph was at the park when several drug users took pills laced with something that caused severe overdoses. He saw [[Wendy Cole]] among them and when her son, [[Truman Cole|Truman]] was separated from her, Ralph picked him up and carried him to the hospital, where he was reunited with his mother. Ralph also told the doctors about Wendy being one of the drug users, which they hadn't known.

When he went to leave, he was stopped by Alex, who noticed that Ralph's shoes were so worn they weren't protecting his feet and he had lesions on his feet. He was taken to a room where his feet were debrided and then his feet were bandaged. He was told to keep them clean and dry, but as he was living in the park, he wasn't sure how he'd be able to do that. He'd maxed out the number of days he was allowed to stay at all the shelters. Jackson desperately called around to try to get him into a shelter, but when he was fruitless, he offered Ralph all the camping supplies he had in his trunk, to keep him warm and dry while he waited for a bed at a shelter to open up.


*He was  at the time of his hospitalization.

'''Reggie Dalton''' is a patient who had a very large post-surgical hernia.


Reggie came into the ER with a hernia. He'd had surgery six months prior and after a while, the hernia developed. He'd had it checked out before, but they said it wasn't urgent, so he put off surgery. But it was allergy season and every time he sneezed, it popped out. He sneezed in the ER and Jo was surprised to see that it was very, very large.

Because of its size, he needed a special surgery to repair it. He started to push it in, saying he'd gotten good at it because of how long it had been. They planned surgery for the next day.

'''Rob Lefkowitz''' is the father of [[Oliver Lefkowitz]].


Rob's son, Oliver, had gastroparesis and was said to have been an epic puker for a long time, which left him unable to eat solid food. He was in the hospital to have adhesions removed and to have a gastric neurostimulator implanted to shock his stomach to remind it to digest his food.

In surgery, [[Jo Wilson]] accidentally perforated his stomach, but [[Alex Karev]] was able to repair the damage and the operation was successful.



Rob is married to [[Lisa Lefkowitz]], with whom he has a son, [[Oliver Lefkowitz]].


Rob has a son, Oliver, who was hospitalized with gastroparesis.

'''Robert Corson''' is a human trafficker who kidnapped [[Jada Williams]] and [[Shanice]].


Bob used Instagram to lure Jada and Shanice out, pretending to be an influencer who could teach them how to make money. When they arrived at the meeting place, the influencer they believed they were meeting wasn't there. Instead, Bob grabbed them and threw them into a van. He threw their phones into the ocean and then took them back to a house, where he locked them in a room in the basement, though it's not clear what the plan was from there.

When Joyce, Jada's mother, discovered the girls missing in the morning, she tracked Jada's phone down by the water, but then the signal died. She then tracked Jada's fitness watch to Bob's house. She knocked on his door, but he slammed the door in her face. When she called for help, she attacked some off-duty firefighters, who then helped her. Bob called the police, claiming there were trespassers on his lawn. [[Officer Wicklund|Officers Wicklund]] and [[Officer Schneider|Schneider]] responded to his call, thought police had ignored Joyce's reports and calls. Bob denied any wrongdoing and asked to have the other people removed. However, this did not happen as a window in the basement shattered due to a fire. Bob exited the house coughing and firefighters went in in search of the two girls. When the girls were pulled out, Bob was arrested, though he continued to deny any wrongdoing and claimed the girls had broken into his house and started a fire. ''("[[Out of Control]]")''

Bob was later taken to the hospital to be treated for smoke inhalation and the burns on his arm. He continued to maintain his innocence as he was treated. In the ER, he had an ischemic stroke and had to have a CT Angio to treat it. ''("[[No Time for Despair]]")''



He works alongside fellow human trafficker [[Opal]]. When he ended up at the hospital, she watched him from a distance to ensure he didn't tell the cops anything.

He had a good relationship with his boss. Despite job offers, he continued to work for Jeffrey until his death.

'''Ron Cole''' is the father of [[Brandon Cole]].


Ron came to the hospital after his son, Brandon, was accidentally shot in the abdomen while playing with his friend, [[Peter Green|Peter]]. They had found [[Patricia Cole|Patricia's]] gun while playing. In the ER, Brandon had no reflexes in his feet, indicating paralysis. They took him into surgery, where Amelia did a spinal decompression to try to avoid paralysis, but when they were forced to defibrillate, it moved his body, undoing that work.

After surgery, Ron and Patricia were told that Brandon would have therapy to help him regain some function, but he'd never walk again.



He is married to [[Patricia Cole]].


His son, Brandon, was shot by his friend Peter, leaving him paralyzed.

'''Rory Petrucci''' is [[Thomas Archibald|Thomas Archibald's]] sous-chef, who came into the hospital with him when his penis was cut off.



Rory, a sous-chef, starting having an affair with her married boss, Thomas Archibald. She believed that he was on the way up and he was taking her with him. They talked about opening a restaurant together as co-chefs.


Rory found Thomas after his penis was cut off by his wife. She retrieved his penis and took him to the hospital, where she gave his penis to the doctors and had her head laceration, which she had sustained when she hit a counter while tending to Thomas, treated.

Thomas's penis was reattached successfully, but when Rory found out that he was staying with his wife, she went into his hospital room and cut his penis off again. [[Stephanie Edwards]] then chased her down and convinced her to hand the penis over so it could be re-attached again.



Rory had an affair with her boss, Thomas Archibald. The affair ended when his wife cut off his penis and he still went back to her. While they were together, they talked about opening a new restaurant together as co-chefs.


Rory is a sous-chef at a restaurant called Archibald\us.

Her mother offered her money to delay the wedding to Chuck for one year. She initially believed it was because her mother didn't really know Chuck, but then came to realize that she was the one who didn't really know Chuck.

'''Sam Roane''' was a patient at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].



Sam decided to attempt to walk coast to coast across the country, stopping only to sleep. He was doing it not for charity (though he fell in with a few charity groups along the way for the snacks), but for the satisfaction of having completed something. However, when he was nearing the coast in [[Seattle]], he was struck by a pick-up truck.


Sam was brought into the ER at Grey Sloan Memorial, where he was diagnosed with blunt trauma injuries, as well as a broken femur which had lacerated his femoral artery, causing blood to pool in his thigh. He was taken to the OR where an external fixator was placed on his leg and his other injuries were repaired.


*He was  at the time of his hospitalization.
*His trip across the country took three months and started in Wilmington, North Carolina.

'''Samar Burman''' is the father of [[Daya Burman]].


Samar came to the hospital with his daughter, Daya, who was born with Moebius syndrome, which left her unable to move the muscles in her face to smile. Samar was nervous about her having the surgery and backed out of consenting four times before. As she was being wheeled to surgery, he tried to back out again, but Daya and the doctors were able to convince him of the importance of Daya having the surgery.

After the surgery, Daya was awake and told she'd need rehab and speech therapy, but she would recover well. 



He was married until his wife died. His daughter tried to get him to date, but he was reluctant because unbeknownst to her, he was secretly dating one of her teachers. When she found out, she was very happy.


He is very protective of his daughter after the death of his wife.


*He and [[Katrina Scott]] go to the same dentist.

'''Sasha''' was a patient of [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] who was injured in the mudslide following the Super Storm.



Sasha\us leg was trapped under her squad car while helping with storm evacuation. Jackson evaluated her leg and assessed that it could probably be saved, but he ordered an ortho consult. He was more concerned about the laceration on her neck, which had debris embedded. Jackson debrided her neck wound. ''("[[Seal Our Fate]]")''


Jackson noticed that there was discoloration of the wound, so he took a sample of the tissue for testing. The test revealed that she had necrotizing fasciitis, so she was taken into surgery. ''("[[Seal Our Fate]]")''

Jackson and April operated and they were able to remove all the necrotic tissue, but the labs suggested that her organs were beginning to fail and she might not make it. ''(\uc[[I Want You With Me]]\ud)''



[[Brian (Season )|Brian]]
Sasha was concerned about Brian, her fianc\ue, who was one of the three first responders still unaccounted for. When [[Oscar Hallis|Oscar]] came to sit by her bedside, she had a moment of hope because she said the handwriting on his leg looked like Brian\us. Later, Brian showed up at the hospital and revealed that he'd been stuck in an air pocket, unable to help and was not the person who triaged survivors. ''("[[Seal Our Fate]]")''

When it looked like Sasha might not make it, she and Brian decided they wanted to get married right away, just in case. When no chaplains were available, Jackson officiated the wedding, with April as a witness. ''(\uc[[I Want You With Me]]\ud)''


Sasha is a police officer in [[Seattle]].

'''Shanice''' is a girl who was kidnapped as part of a human trafficking operation.


Shanice and her friend, [[Jada Williams|Jada]], were having a sleepover. They'd been talking to someone on Instagram whom they believed to be a young influencer who offered to teach them how to make a lot of money. They left the house in the middle of the night to meet her, but when they arrived, she wasn't there. Instead, [[Robert Corson]] grabbed them and put them in a van. He then took them back to his house and locked them in a room in the basement.

Jada and Shanice heard voices, which made them believe they were being rescued. They then didn't hear voices anymore, so they decided to start a fire to try to lure rescue. They started the fire and watched as it burned around them. They were finally rescued when the fire drew the attention of the firefighters outside. Sullivan and Dean decided not to wait for gear and went into the house in their street clothes. They followed the girls' voices to the basement and then to a locked door. They kicked in the door and pulled both girls out. Once they were outside, they started breathing again. When Shanice was loaded into an aid car, she explained what had happened and apologized. There was a confrontation between the cops and the others, during which Jada's mother, Joyce, was arrested, along with two firefighters. Jada and Shanice were taken to the hospital to be treated. ''("[[Out of Control]]")''

In the ER, Shanice was treated for smoke inhalation. Her mother was told that if her chest x-ray was clear, she'd be discharged to go home. ''("[[No Time for Despair]]")''

'''Sharon''' is the mother of [[Shanice]].


Sharon came to the house of [[Robert Corson]] when [[Joyce Williams]] called her to tell her she believed their daughters had been kidnapped and were inside the house. She was upset with Joyce for not preventing the kidnapping, but quickly ended up insisting they get in the house along with Joyce. When the cops arrived, they tried to remove the women, saying the homeowner had complained about them creating a disturbance. When a window broke, leading them to a fire that was burning in the basement, Dean and Sullivan went inside after them. They were able to follow the sounds of their voices to a locked room where they found the two girls and pulled them out. Once they were outside, the girls started to breathe again. Sharon got into the ambulance with Shanice, who was given oxygen. Shanice apologized, explaining what had happened and confessing that they started the fire in order to lure help. [[Officer Schneider]] heard her say this and noted it on his notebook, then went to question Jada about the fire while Sharon and Shanice were taken to the hospital. ''("[[Out of Control]]")''

In the ER, Shanice was treated for smoke inhalation and then moved to a room while waiting for a chest x-ray. Sharon was told she could take Shanice home if it was clear. Sharon was upset because even though there was a pandemic and her daughter had been kidnapped, she had to get up the next day and go back to work.



She was upset when her daughter was kidnapped after staying the night at a friend's house. When the girls were found safe, Sharon reassured her daughter that it wasn't her fault.

Stacy went with the kids to the ER, where she was the one to tell Brandon and Peter's moms that the kids had found [[Patricia Cole|Patricia's]] gun and that's how Brandon was shot.

'''Steve Lee''' is the father of [[Kayden Lee]].


Steve came to the hospital when he learned that his son, Kayden, had been seriously burned. Due to Covid- restrictions, he and his wife had to wait outside the hospital while Kayden was treated, which was especially hard for Deborah. She decided to sneak in and look for Kayden. With Richard's help, she found him and spent some time looking over him before going back outside, where she told her husband how bad Kayden looked. When the parent of another child injured in the fire Kayden accidentally started, [[Aaron Morris]], arrived, Steve and Aaron got into a fight about the series of events that led to their kids getting injured. The fight became physical and both Steve and Aaron were injured. ''("[[All Tomorrow's Parties]]")''

As his nose was treated in the ER, Steve expressed regret for allowing Kayden to leave the house. He worried when he learned that Kayden had been taken back into surgery. Later, when the doctors came to find him and said they should go out and talk to his wife, he realized that meant Kayden was dead and started to break down in the ER. Aaron Morris saw this and came over to comfort him. ''("[[The Center Won't Hold]]")''



He is married to [[Deborah Lee]].


He and his wife have a son, Kayden, who was severely burn after trying to fix his overheated car. ''("[[All Tomorrow's Parties]]")''

'''Stuart Cole''' is the husband of [[Wendy Cole]].


Stuart's wife, Wendy, was at the park with her son to score drugs. She bought pills that were laced with something that caused massive overdoses. When she overdosed, she was separated from her son Truman. At the hospital, she searched for him, hoping someone had seen him at the park and taken him to the hospital. The doctors tried to calm her down, believing her stress was the reason for her high blood pressure. When [[Ralph Tennyson]] came into the ER, bringing her son, Truman, he also informed the doctors that Wendy had been using drugs.

The doctors called her husband and he came to the hospital to pick up Truman. He was upset that he hadn't noticed that his wife had gotten hooked on drugs after taking someone else's leftover pain medication. She was quickly arrested. Alex advised Stuart to keep their son away from her and protect him.



He is married to [[Wendy Cole]].


He and his wife have a son, [[Truman Cole]].

Susan went along on on her daughter, [[Julie Hamilton|Julie's]], field trip to the hospital. When a trauma interrupted their tour, she suggested they just go back to the school. However, the bus drive was not immediately available, so the kids were taken to see the babies and then shown scans of foreign objects in patients' bodies.

When the bus finally arrived back at the hospital to take them back to school, Susan noticed that Julie wasn't on the bus, so they began to search for her. When mother and daughter were reunited, Susan hugged Julie.



Susan has a daughter, Julie. When Julie became lost during a field trip the hospital, she was very worried. When they were reunited, she hugged Julie.

She also has a father or father-in-law who had a heart transplant, which may have inspired Julie's desire to become a surgeon.

'''Taryn Davis''' is a patient at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].



Some time before her hospitalization, she went with her father on a business trip to Brazil. While she was there, she contracted an infection which caused adrenal insufficiency.


When she had stomach pain and was vomiting, her father brought her into the hospital. He told Jo that the symptoms started the previous night. They had Halloween early because he had to leave for a business trip on Halloween. They watched a scary movie and ate some candy.

When Taryn asked if she would still be able to trick or treat, Jo informed her that the best trick or treating happened at the hospital.

They discovered that she had adrenal insufficiency, meaning she could be scared to death, but when they went to tell her father, they found that she had wandered off. She was walking the halls of the hospital, attempting to trick or treat when she was scared by an old patient of [[Heather Brooks]] and collapsed. Alex found her and rushed her to the PICU.



[[Mr. Davis]]
She looks up to her father and was excited to go on a business trip to him when he went to Brazil.


*She loves Halloween.

'''Tatiana Flauto''' is a patient who had acid thrown in her face and required several surgeries to fix it.


Tatiana came into the ER with facial burning after a stranger threw acid on her. A bystander gave her a towel with ice on it, which adhered to the burns, so they had to use saline to remove the towel. She was worried, so Jackson said that the two of them were a team, so they'd be together through the whole process.

A few months after that, she had facial reanimation surgery.

When April and Jackson got married, she looked at their wedding album while at the hospital after yet another surgery and said that April was a beautiful bride and that she wanted the chance to be a beautiful bride someday.

A year and a half into her treatment, she became discouraged and wanted to quit. However, Jackson was able to convince her to continue.

During her treatment, she had two paramedian forehead flaps become necrotic.

After her final surgery, a nasal septum reconstruction, she was finally pleased with the result.



She married a man named Timothy. They had a fight the morning of their wedding, but Jackson said they'd probably have the same fights for  years and not to let a little thing become a big thing. Jackson then walked her down the aisle at her wedding.


While Jackson was her doctor, the two grew close, to the point where after all her surgeries were completed, he walked her down the aisle at her wedding. She knew about him losing his son and his marital troubles. She said that he kept every promise he made to her.


*She had  surgeries over a span of four years, three months, one week, and four days.

'''Thom''' is the best friend of [[Donald Mercer]], a patient at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].



When his friend Donald needed a kidney to save his life, Thom agreed to donate his.


About four months after the kidney donation, Donald was in a car accident during which he flew through a windshield and fractured his skull, causing brain death. Upon finding this out, Thom asked the doctors if there was any way he could get his donated kidney back. His rationale was that Donald wasn't using it for the agreed upon purpose, saving his life, so Thom should get it back. He threatened to sue the hospital if they didn't agree to give him the kidney back.

When he found out that Donald had suffered cardiac death while waiting the six hours to be cleared to donate his organs, he was very upset about losing his friend.



[[Donald Mercer]]
He was friends with Donald from seventh grade until Donald's death. They were close to the point where Thom donated a kidney when Donald needed one to save his life. When Thom found out that Donald was brain dead, he became upset that Donald wasn't holding up his end of the contract by living.

'''Thomas Archibald''' is a chef who was brought into the ER after his wife cut off his penis.



Thomas started an affair with his sous-chef, [[Rory Petrucci]]. They talked about opening a restaurant together and being co-chefs.


When Thomas's wife, Marcia, found out that he was sleeping with Rory, she took a sharp knife and cut off his penis then stuck it in a pot at Rory\us station. Rory found Thomas covered in blood. Rory put the penis in a bag and took it and Thomas to the hospital to be treated.

The doctors were able to clean the penis and re-attach it. When Marcia showed up at the hospital, they called security, but Thomas revealed that he had called her and planned to forgive her for cutting off his penis and she forgave him for sleeping with Rory, which was against their arrangement, wherein he was allowed to sleep with waitresses and hostesses.

When Rory saw that Thomas was going to stay with Marcia, she came into his room and cut off his penis a second time and then took off with it. [[Stephanie Edwards]] chased her down and convinced her to hand over the penis, so it could be re-attached again.



Thomas is married to [[Marcia Archibald]]. They have an agreement wherein he's allowed to sleep with waitresses and hostesses, but others are off limits. He broke this agreement when he slept with his sous-chef, [[Rory Petrucci]]. However, they forgave each other and decided to stay together.


Thomas is a chef at Archibald's, a famous restaurant in [[Seattle]].


*[[Miranda Bailey]] said that she\ud been trying to get a reservation at Archibald\us.

'''Todd Eames''' is the brother of [[Laura Eames]].



When he was in graduate school, he told his dissertation chair that he wanted to study the impact of climate change on global migration, an inter-disciplinary study. And he did it, even though it meant a lot of long nights, instead of the atmospheric effect of moss, which is what she wanted him to study. ''("[[Should I Stay or Should I Go]]")''


Todd came to the hospital with his sister, Laura, when she was scheduled to have a mitral valve repair. She was also  weeks pregnant and he'd been to all of her appointments. While she went to have her surgery, he waited in the waiting room, watching a show and eating chips. When Jo came to tell him that they'd been unable to complete her procedure due to a complication and it would have to be rescheduled, she also asked him if he'd want to go get a drink with her. He accepted and at the end of the day, they left the hospital together. ''("[[Put the Squeeze On Me]]")'' 

When Laura's surgery was rescheduled, he bought her a fruit basket. Laura reminded him that she couldn't eat before surgery, so he gave the basket to Jo instead. He then asked her to have dinner. She declined, because she had to focus on studying for her annual OB/GYN resident exam, but accepted the gifts and study snacks he brought. ''("[[Road Trippin']]")''


Laura made cookies, which Todd brought to the hospital for Jo. While he was there, they made a plan to go to Joe's after she was finished with work. At Joe's, Jo told him and Link that Bailey had begged her to come back to general surgery. She was torn between her passion for OB/GYN and wanted to honor Bailey. Todd suggested that she could do both, doing her residency during the day and moonlighting in general surgery. Link offered to help with Luna to facilitate this. Todd offered to help as well, but realized how odd that was and rescinded his offer. ''("[[Should I Stay or Should I Go]]")''



When his sister was in the hospital for a mitral valve repair, he flirted with his sister's doctor, [[Jo Wilson]]. When she asked him to go get a drink at Joe's, he accepted and they left the hospital together. ''("[[Put the Squeeze On Me]]")''

Later, Todd brought Jo study snacks and asked her to have dinner, but she had to decline because she needed to study, though she did accept his gifts. ''("[[Road Trippin']]")''

They continued seeing each other, even getting drinks at Joe's with Link, at which point they helped Jo decide she could help Bailey by taking on some surgeries while also continuing her OB/GYN residency. ''("[[Should I Stay or Should I Go]]")''

When they had sex and Todd stayed over for the first time, Todd woke up Luna when he sang during his orgasm. The next morning, Todd walked Jo and Luna all the way to the door of the hospital, holding an umbrella to keep them dry. He later visited the hospital to bring Jo a bear, but she said it wasn't working for her and ended things between them. He handed the bear to a nearby custodian and left the hospital. ''("[[Out for Blood]]")''


When his sister decided to have a baby on her own, he was immediately supportive and drew up a spreadsheet for her, on which he tracked everything related to her pregnancy.


He has a PhD in environmental science.


*He's a fan of a show called Ready, Set, Globe.<ref>[[Put the Squeeze On Me]], x</ref>

'''Val Ashton''' is a patient who had an abdominal pregnancy.


Val came into the ER with abdominal pain and vomiting for the past two weeks. She knew she didn't have Covid, she said, because she hadn't gone anywhere or seen anyone. Jo told her in the ER that her abdominal pain was due to pregnancy, so she was moved into a room. Carina did an ultrasound, which showed an empty uterus, so they started looking for other causes for the positive pregnancy test. They did a CT, which showed a fetus growing near her liver. She was told she was about  weeks along. Carina asked her if she wanted the baby. When she said she did, they told her her baby would need to be delivered right away, as waiting carried the risk of catastrophic bleeding from her liver. They took her into surgery, where Carina did a C-section. Her baby, whom she named Luna, was intubated and then taken to the NICU. Val's liver started bleeding, forcing them to remove one of the lobes, putting Val at risk for liver failure, but stopping the bleeding. ''("[[My Happy Ending]]")''

Val was still in the hospital after her partial liver resection. She had concerned labs, so Jo ordered a CT, which showed a pseudoaneurysm, which required surgery. Val was upset with having to see her daughter only on a phone screen, but Jo explained that neither of them was stable enough to visit the other. Val begged Jo to help make parenthood real for her. After Val's surgery, Jo suspected she might still end up needing a transplant since they'd had to remove so much of her liver. ''("[[Fight the Power]]")''

Two days after her surgery, Val was severely jaundiced and septic. She struggled with not being able to see Luna, worried that she was scared and alone. She tried to convince Jo that she was healthy enough to go see Luna, but Jo knew she was lying. Jo ordered a CT and labs, which showed that her liver was failing, so she ordered liver dialysis. Despite this, Val later coded and was unable to be resuscitated. ''("[[Helplessly Hoping]]")''



She is divorced. She and her ex-husband tried conceiving for eight years, including six rounds of IVF. He blamed her for every failed cycle, asking what she should have done differently. They grew to hate each other and so divorced. She then had a one-night stand with a man who rented their back room and became pregnant, leading her to understand that it was never her fault.


Her daughter, Luna, was born at  weeks' gestation after growing on her liver instead of in her uterus. ''("[[My Happy Ending]]")'' Shortly after Luna's birth, Val contacted Newman and told him about her. He wished her luck, but signed over his parental rights, leaving Val as Luna's sole parent. ''("[[Helplessly Hoping]]")'' After she died, [[Carmen Delgado]] became her legal guardian. Months later, after many hoops to jump through, Jo Wilson adopted her. ''("[[Someone Saved My Life Tonight]]")''


She worked in publishing.


*She enjoyed raunchy romance novels.<ref>[[Fight the Power]], x</ref>

'''Veronica Kays''' is a woman who came into the clinic with a rash and was diagnosed with pancreatic cancer.



Veronica and her childhood best friend, [[Jeremy]], made a pact that if they were still single at age , they'd make a baby together. Veronica pictured it being a test tube conception, but learned how expensive that was. They got drunk one night and had sex, which resulted in Veronica being pregnant.


Veronica went to the courthouse to fight a traffic ticket, banking on the cop not showing up. She admitted she had run the stop sign, but because she was pregnant, she needed every dollar she could save to help pay for that. In the security line at the courthouse, she met Alex, who noticed a rash on her hands. He told her he worked at a free clinic and recommended that she get the rash checked out.


Later that day, Veronica came to the clinic and Alex examined her. In addition to the rash, he also noticed yellow in the whites of her eyes, indicating jaundice, and she noted that she'd lost weight despite being sixteen weeks pregnant. Suspecting that she had pancreatic cancer, Alex insisted that she get a surgical consult from Bailey. Bailey ran tests and confirmed Alex's suspicions. She had advanced pancreatic cancer and needed to start treatment immediately.

Veronica was told that Bailey recommended termination so she could start chemotherapy the next day. Veronica resisted, because even with treatment, she only had less than a year to live. However, without treatment, she wouldn't live long enough to have a healthy baby. Alex suggested a Whipple, which would remove the bulk of the tumor, which could buy her enough time to deliver a healthy baby. Bailey refused, but when Veronica talked to her about seeing images of the baby growing up with Jeremy and not seeing those when she went the way Bailey was suggesting, Bailey agreed to do the surgery.

The surgery went well and they hoped it would buy her enough time. However, she was still terminal herself. ''("[[Roar]]")''


When she was  weeks and  days pregnant, Veronica came back to the hospital with back pain, which she'd had for a week. An MRI showed that the cancer had spread to her spine and she needed to have a c-section that day. Before her surgery, she signed a DNR. Arizona easily delivered her baby, but she developed a clot that went to her lung and she struggled to breathe after the delivery. They said she could rescind her DNR, but she said she was tired and so they just stayed with her while she died. After she was gone, Alex told Jeremy about her death and he cried. ''("[[Don't Stop Me Now]]")''



She and [[Jeremy]] have a son together.


She and Jeremy met as children and became friends. Their friendship remained into adulthood, when they made a pact to have a baby together at age  if they were still single then. When the time came, the learned it would be expensive. However, a drunken night led to them conceiving a child together. ''("[[Roar]]")''

As she was dying, she admitted that she loved Jeremy and had never told him that. She asked Amelia to tell him not to look back and to be brave for their son. ''("[[Don't Stop Me Now]]")''


*She doesn't believe in God.<ref>[[Roar]], x</ref>
*Hospitals give her the creeps.<ref>[[Roar]], x</ref>
*She thinks that people need to start with Episode  when watching the Star Wars movies.<ref>[[Roar]], x</ref>
*Her last words were "The baby\us good?"<ref>[[Don't Stop Me Now]], x</ref>

'''Vicki Ann Rudin''' is the birth mother of [[Jo Wilson]].


She grew up on a farm in Kansas.

When Vicki was a freshman in college, her TA took immediate interest in her. He pursued her until she said yes to a date with him. On the date, he started kissing her. She tried to stop him, but he wouldn't take no for an answer and raped her. While she was pregnant, she was terrified that she'd give birth to a boy that had her rapist's face. She'd heard about women seeing their babies for the first time and their hearts cracking open. Nine months later, she gave birth to [[Jo Wilson]] at Emerson Hospital. She left as soon as possible and her heart cracked open just like she'd heard it would, but as much as she tried, it couldn't be just the two of them. Five days after giving birth, she left Jo at a fire station.

Later, she found her way to therapy and worked through her PTSD and triggers. At graduate school, she met [[Daniel Rudin]], whom she later married. They also had two children.

Jo wanted answers and traveled to her home to find them. She asked Vicki to have one conversation with her at a nearby diner. During their conversation, Vicki told Jo the story of how she came to be, but Jo was angry with her for not making sure she ended up with a family who wanted a baby. Vicki replies that she did the best she could and that even though she feels sorry for what happened to Jo, she remains confident that she couldn't have been a good mother to her at the time.



She is married to [[Daniel Rudin]]. They met in graduate school.


She and her husband have two children: Alexandra, who is a senior in high school and Josh, who is a sophomore.

Her mother's parents died young, one of heart disease and the other of cancer.


She works for the mayor's office, trying to create jobs in underserved communities.


*Her family has a dog named Chip.
*She's full Irish on her father's side and Russian Jewish and Italian on her mother's.
*She was the spelling bee champ four years in a row.
*She loves the smell of rosemary.
*She's terrible at math.

'''Warren Sterman''' was a patient who came in with a bowel obstruction.



Warren went to medical school. He ended up quitting his last year of clinics and instead went into medical research.


He developed a bowel obstruction, for which he required surgery. After his surgery, it took a while for his bowel to start working again, so he had to stay an extra night. He eventually did have a bowel movement, meaning he could be discharged. ''("[[Shake Your Groove Thing]]")''

Over the next several years, he continued to see Bailey every few years to have another portion of his bowel removed. ''("[[Head Over High Heels]]")''


Warren returned to the hospital when his grandson, Josh, needed spinal surgery. When Josh died due to surgical error, he was heartbroken. ''("[[Head Over High Heels]]")''


Warren was heard some noise one morning and learned that a local cult leader, [[Brother John]], was on the roof leading the crowd in a dance, he called emergency services. When the firefighters arrived, Warren went to the scene and introduced himself. He said the followers weren't grounded in reality and would do whatever John told them to do. He also later warned them to look out for John, as he appeared crazy, but was really dangerous as he was charming. ''("[[Learning to Fly]]")''



He is married. His marriage was in trouble for a while after he finished medical school. That's part of the reason why he switched to medical research.


Warren does medical research. He likes it because it allows him to work reasonable hours and then be with his family.


*There is a -episode gap between his [[Shake Your Groove Thing|first]] and [[Head Over High Heels|second]] appearance, making him the character with the longest gap between two appearances.

'''Wendy Cole''' is a woman who came into the hospital following the mass overdose.


Wendy was at the park with her son to score drugs. She bought pills that were laced with something that caused massive overdoses. When she overdosed, she was separated from her son Truman. At the hospital, she searched for him, hoping someone had seen him at the park and taken him to the hospital. The doctors tried to calm her down, believing her stress was the reason for her high blood pressure. When [[Ralph Tennyson]] came into the ER, bringing her son, Truman, he also informed the doctors that Wendy had been using drugs.

The doctors called her husband and he came to the hospital to pick up Truman. He was upset that he hadn't noticed that his wife had gotten hooked on drugs after taking someone else's leftover pain medication. She was quickly arrested. Alex advised Stuart to keep their son away from her and protect him.



She is married to [[Stuart Cole]].


She and her husband have a son named [[Truman Cole]].

'''Zach Mischer''' is the husband of [[Duncan Mischer]], a patient at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].


Miranda Bailey explained to Zach and Duncan that they would be removing part of Duncan's colon to graft it into his throat after removing a tumor in his esophagus. Zach commented that now when he gives a restaurant a bad review, they can really say that he's talking out his ass, but Duncan counters that he can truly say their food tastes like crap. Bailey insisted that the food would not taste like crap.

Bailey and Jo Wilson operated. Duncan's bowel was perforated and there was leaking in his abdominal cavity which was ultimately resolved and the surgery was successful.



Zach is married to [[Duncan Mischer]], a food critic.
